Then my meal arrived and wow!! It looked and smelled amazing and amazingly like my mom's stroganoff.  My friends even said it smelled awesome and I was nice and shared!  It was a HUGE pasta plate full of yummy egg noodles with tender pieces of beef, and a nice thick caramelized brownish mushroom/onion au jus reduction sauce with a bit of cream...perfect for me!  It was garnished with fresh sugarsnap peas, carrots and one of their yummy rolls!  I ate it along with my friends and wiped up every last drop with the roll.  Definitely the best stroganoff I have ever had in a restaurant!  

I will definitely be back for a drink here; the mixologists are wonderful (so good, I can't even call them bartenders).  The menu prices are steep, so I would probably only come here on a special occasion for the food.  But, I must say this would be a great date spot or a place for visitors from out of town because the views of Camelback Mountain and the surrounding neighborhood/architecture are beautiful.
Gorgeous grounds and fantastic happy  hour
Great outside dining and bar is outside but covered. Stickey buns are a tradition and a must! Great place to bring out of town guests.

This restaurant was recommended by a friend. It was NOT what we expected. View of Camelback Mtn. is great but it ends there. We were told by the host that even if we sat at the bar we could not order ANY food--he said the kitchen was really backed up. THAT we have never heard before as we often sit at the bar. We should have turned around but had a drink at the bar. We told the bartender the host said we couldn't order food and he said "that's not true, that's ridiculous." As much as he tried to expedite our appetizer, which we did end up ordering, and later our entrees, we should have left before ordering any food. In fact 2 other servers were complaining that their diners had gotten up and walked out, disgruntled waiting for their food.

It's a shame because it's in a very nice area, Paradise Valley, and with such a lovely setting the service should be top notch. The entrees were good but not worth the  wait.

I've had this restaurant bookmarked to try for over 3 yrs but was hesitant because I was not big in formal or pretentious settings.  I am so glad I finally came here! The service was impeccable and I absolutely loved the spinach gnocchi that came with my meal. The texture was both gooey and pillowy at the same time and it had a hint of lobster demi-glaze versus being drowned in sauce. My main course, a white fish that was similar to sea bass, was very tasty as well. loved the western atmosphere and even though it was a bit formal, it was not pretentious at all. I will definitely be back for brunch.

I would probably give it a 4.5.  The sticky buns are all they're cracked up to be!! Delicious. I ordered the filet and it was delicious and like butter. I ordered it medium rare, I know it's not how ladies usually order it... I even got a double ask from the server; honestly, I wouldn't go above medium to keep the integrity of this fine cut of meat. The scalloped potatoes were pretty great too! My date ordered the special of the night prime rib with southwestern mac and cheese. It was very good, but my filet was better. 

The patio with this weather was absolutely perfect! I would go again for a special occasion.

This will be my first Yelp review ever! That's how awful this food was! I have never been to a place where all 6 people hated their meal! If I could give this place ZERO stars.... I would! I entertain people all over the valley. The worst food I have ever had in my life at a "nice restaurant". Unequivocally, I have had better steak at chain restaurants. I'm pretty sure they serve instant potatoes.... Seriously! DO NOT GO HERE! I was EMBARRASSED to take my wife here on our anniversary dinner with close friends. 

On a positive note the sticky buns were great! The patio is amazing. However, I do not go to restaurants for cinnamon rolls. You will be better off going to Outback Steakhouse, or eat a strangers Applebee's leftovers. It's not like the food was cooked incorrectly. The food was just so bland and repulsive!

Go to Rockerji or Mastros! 

I'm legitimately sad to have wasted money and calories on their food!
Had my daughters wedding here and couldn't have been happier. The grounds, food and staff were off the charts. Best wedding ever!!!  Thank you so much for making it so special.

Come for the ambiance, not the food!  Being Chicago foodies, restaurants have a hard time living up to our standards. We started with the anchovy Caesar, lump crab and tuna poke, lobster Mac'n cheese and crispy chicken livers - mediocre at best. When I can create and serve better food at home and I'm not the worlds greatest cook, you know the food is ehhhh. Everything was very bland. Barely any flavors in all the dishes. 

We all were praying our entrees would be better. We had the fire roasted shrimp w garlic and pine nut risotto. The shrimp were excellent, I'm sad the risotto was made with goat cheese (and I eat everything but Goat cheese!). Being such a pungent flavor, they may want to add that to the menu description. The seafood pasta week and needed seasoning, Mediterranean chicken dry, dry, dry. The best was the fresh catch of the day (Mahi) and that too was just ok. 

After trying all the dishes mentioned above and not one stood out, it's disappointing. I could have bought a great handbag for the price of dinner, but it's not the loss of money that's the bummer, it was the whole aesthetics of the food experience that left us sad :(( 

The best part was actually the wine, and that was served lukewarm.

A Phoenix tradition sine 1930 so how bad can it be????   Outstanding sticky buns and wonderful outdoor seating with plenty of umbrellas and heaters along with views of Camelback mtn.  couple of items they have  changed that they need to change back.  bring back the relish tray and put the french fried lobster back on the menu as an entree and not as an appetizer served as lobster  fried nuggets.  Places come and go in Phoenix but there is comfort in the tradition of El Choro.

We had dinner at El Chorro as a part of their soft opening.  The restaurant looks terrific and still has the ambiance of one of the grand old dames of Phoenix restaurants.  The menu is well suited for the stature of the restaurant.  Classic meals including duck, steak, lamb chops, pork chops and fish.  The food is good but not quite at the point of being terrific or memorable.  It will continue to satisfy the long time customers of this restaurant.  If you want a good solid meal where everyone will like something El Chorro continues to fill the bill.  I hope that as they settle in to their second life that some of those nuanced flavors that Chef Kassels was famous for in Santa Fe can emerge so that El Chorro is not just brunch on Sundays and special occassions but also a wonderfully, memorable meal.

I had one the the best Kale Salads of my life here. Probably because it was covered in candied walnuts, dried cranberries, and several other non-kale items

Because of the huge salad, I ended up eating the half order of lamb chops, which also tasted great.  They were cooked a perfect medium rare and did not have the gamey taste that I've been disappointed with at other places.

Sitting outside at night made the ambience a bit too romantic, since it was just me and fellow coworker eating. Also made it hard to take pics of my food :P

Delicious classic food. Love coming here for family dinners, as their food is always made to perfection. The shrimp cocktail is a great appetizer and I typically go with the salmon. And don't forget the sticky rolls, they're to die for (the leftovers are also good for morning coffee :) ). They always have blankets for their guests too, which is great if you're anything like me and get cold easily- such a considerate thing and the hospitality goes a long way.

My husband and I finally made it back last night for a do over. We arrived about 4 and sat at the bar for HH.  Everyone behind the bar was very attentive from the start.  I had the HH margarita and my hubby grey goose Cosmo - perfect.  By 4:30-4:45 the bar was full.  We decided not to order off HH menu although everyone around us did and it all looked great.  We had the pepper pot shrimp - so delicious! I wasn't sure about the beer broth when we ordered but such a nice compliment and the dipping bread...yum!  We also tried the flash fried lobster with drawn butter (not needed) but the aioli was great and the batter was so light it did not take away from the lobster.  Our bartender Jason was so great very attentive but did not rush.  Our experience had gone so well we felt we needed to stay for dinner.  We shared the filet cooked at medium as ordered which came with a portion of scalloped potatoes and brocollini, lobster Mac and cheese - good, and the steamed spinach.  Everything tasted SO good.  Overall it couldn't have been better.  You would never have known they were hosting a wedding and 3 other events last night.  Thank you, especially Jason and Ryan!

We visit El Chorro every year when we come to Phoenix for Spring Training. It is always a lovely delicious restaurant. One thing that always strikes us is how professional, courteous and attentive the wait we I e is. They go above and beyond as a team working to give every table impeccable service! We always have the chicken liver appetizer which is unique and delicious. We really enjoyed the seafood pasta and free range chicken as well. Wish we had a restaurant like this in San Diego!

Second trip back. Forward one week.  Today's table was cozily situated next to a gorgeous fireplace which was needed because as the afternoon waned the chill set in.  As always the ambiance was 5 stars.  But....service was hard to locate.  In fact, after sitting and chatting and chatting we decided to hunt down some wait staff.  We got bits and pieces of many servers but never the full attention of one person.  Why was this?  It wasn't that crowded...?  The happy hour food makes a great late lunch.   If you team that with a cocktail it is the best meal to be had.  Interesting to have a salad on the happy hour menu but it worked...for one...no sharing on that one.  If the management could add a few perky waiters or waitresses this place could be heaven.

This place was designed for the perfect Saturday.  There is a mix of old and new with most of the same charms from prior to the renovation.  I'm sure the dinner menu tastes as yummy as it looks, but with their bar menu and the bocce ball court, I'm not sure why you'd ever sit down to eat!  Chowing down on their burger in between bocce ball throws, sipping a super refreshing, perfect-for-summer cocktail, and staring at some of the best views in Phoenix is the way to experience El Chorro Lodge.  This place is great for everyone: big groups, a romantic dinner, a place to eat while the kids run on the grass, or a dinner with a client.

El Charro is one of the most beautiful restaurants in the valley, but sadly the food is sub par. I ordered the breakfast burrito and it was mostly a tough, chewy, gummy tortilla with dry scrambled flavorless eggs inside. There was some dry stringy mystery meat inside. Ate about one fourth of it. Thank God for the sticky buns or it would have been a total loss.

A delightful experience. Outside table on a lovely Saturday evening, great service by Brent, delicious salad - wine - entrees!
We will be back soon.
Ole!  Fun spot!  Remodel did not ruin the original feel for the place.  Go if you haven't been - and has a excellent happy hour.

Back to being mediocre.  Go for a drink and a shrimp cocktail and be happy you are in such a beautiful setting with less than average food.  Really a shame to botch Beef Stroganoff, shrimp in mystery sauce, and even the Caesar Salad was bad.  We live across the street and were invited to go....we wouldn't go unless it was an invite for a special occasion.  To many better restaurants to go just for the beautiful view.  We have it all the time!  Bad food is not tolerable, even if the ambience is magnificent.

Luck you, Phoenix. To have such a fabulous restaurant in driving distance!

Pulled up to valet, got out and sucked in my breath. This place is GORGEOUS. From palm trees to outdoor fireplaces this is one of the nicest restaurants I've ever seen. I really love how warm and inviting it is. There is an abundance of outdoor seating and with the heat lamps and fireplace it really does keep the temperature nice and toasty (it was a mild 55). 

Went into the bar and sat down at high top tables and was greeted with a basket of nirvana in the form of sticky buns. They know they could sell these things, right? WTH? I have never in all of my life been greeted with something so delicious when I sat down at a restaurant table. Go away, Cinnabon, you've been replaced, and handily. Hasta. 

Ordered a glass of mediocre wine, Bogle. You can buy this wine for $8 a bottle at Total Wine so I certainly wouldn't pay $9 for a glass, but I wasn't paying, so...it was decent if you're getting it for free!

Anyway, onto the bar menu, which the only thing I ate off of. Ordered the mini grilled cheese sandwiches with three artisan cheeses. One happened to be blue cheese which I despise and waited until the last one to eat it. I asked the waitress, fabulous Rachel, if I could replace this with the brie and she said of course! She then proceeded to bring me a WHOLE plate of sandwiches! For free! You have to love great service! A co-worker got the chicken enchiladas, and while they were delicious, they had a sting to them so be careful! Those were on the dinner menu, not bar menu, by the way. 

As we were leaving I asked for some sticky buns to go and Rachel brought a nice sized to go box of them for us. Thank you!!! 

I could see spending a lot of time here if I lived in this area. It's beautiful, the staff is friendly (especially Rachel!) and the food is delicious! I would definitely highly recommend and I'll be SO jealous if you go!

Went there for the first time last night and it was great! The happy hour prices can't be beat and the crispy shrimp was crazy delicious. So good, we ordered a second helping. This may become one of my new go-to happy hour spots - just wish it extended past 6 p.m. 

I would love to go back for dinner on the patio.

We went to El Chorro for the thanksgiving buffet. As it was a holiday I did not bulk at the $70/person fee, however if I am spending that kind of $ for a dinner I have expectations for food quality and service. The service was below average even for a buffet. We were not greeted as we set down and no one bothered to check if we needed drinks or to explain the layout of the dinner. Our server finally showed up 1/2 through after we asked for a glass of wine.  The only other time we saw her was with the check.

The food on the buffet was generally good. The beef tenderloin was rare and juicy, but the turkey and salmon were dry. The veggies and salad fixings were tasty however. 

The wine and liquor list was good with enough variety to please most patrons.

Overall I might return on a regular night to give it another try but at regular $$. There are definitely better options in the area to patronize

I've been here before but never got around to posting a review. Figured I'd post something right now since I'm laying in bed like a slob. Really had the intentions to go to the gym this morning but decided to eat leftover sticky buns in bed instead. 

My boyfriend and I went for AZ restaurant week and both ordered from the ARW menu. For the first course, we split the Caesar salad and the cheese course. We both wished the lettuce was chopped up but I understand it's for appearance. Instead of normal croutons, they used polenta croutons which I enjoyed but my boyfriend didn't. 

For our main entrees, I went with the halibut dish that came with jasmine rice and bok choy. It was a very simple dish. I liked it but nothing about it stood out. My boyfriend ordered the center cut filet. He really liked the peppercorn sauce and it was nicely put together. I remember him saying it was a great cut of steak. 

For our final courses, we decided to take them to go because we were so stuffed. We took home the strawberry shortcake and the Chocolate cake. I wish we actually looked at the description or had our server tell us about the desserts. He listed our options but never mentioned anything about them. I was expecting a fluffy light strawberry shortcake with Angel food cake. Or maybe cake-like with pound cake, but when we got home, we found out it was just a biscuit cut in half horizontally with whipped cream and strawberry puree. Not really all that great to he honest. The chocolate cake is still in our fridge but I'll dig into it later tonight. No way anyone can screw it up right? It's chocolate cake!

Service was just average, nothing really to complain about. The drinks did take quite awhile but the server apologized each time. I enjoyed it the first few times we came so it will still be on our list of places to grab dinner or brunch.

This place is a mess: What a joke. The owner (the creepy guy with he fake teeth in an all white suit - looks like Ted Knight in Caddyshack) was a complete a-hole. Our waitress was rude, the hostess was rude. Drinks were bad. We called ahead to reserve a table outside for happy hour on the patio at a table to which they said you don't need one it's first come first serve. We get there and it's only at the bar and communal table so we have to sit inside at 4:30 when the entire patio is empty. We have eaten out there for HH before. Maybe this place is fun if you're senile but the cute fountain outside isn't worth the crappy attitudes and bad drinks. Apparently the food is terrible too but I didn't wait around to find out. Don't waste your money or your time.

Decided to come here for our fancy meal of the trip - made the right choice!! Decided to sit outside and it was nice - breezy, a little dark.. but that bodes well with the intimate/upscale feel of the area. 

Our waiter was friendly and patient while we decided what we wanted to order. Decided on the crab cakes for our app, seafood pasta and short ribs for our entrees. There was a mix up with our app so we ended up being able to try the pepper pot shrimp as well, which was really delicious.

The food was FABULOUS - all the flavors were there and it was SO ENJOYABLE. The short ribs were cooked perfectly and melts in your mouth. Crab cakes and shrimp were super flavorful and rich as well. 

Only small thing is the pasta seemed to be cooked similarly to the shrimp - felt like I was eating the same flavors.. just with noodles. 

I guess it was the end of the night since our waiter brought out sticky buns for us, thank you!! They were a wonderful finish to our meal, although it's honestly a classier cinnamon roll. 

And being that we were there pretty late/the last table, the restaurant promptly turned off the lights as soon as we paid.. not sure how I feel about that. Regardless, the food was worth it and done nearly to perfection.

This isn't a place to come weekly since it's so upscale, but this place is definitely a strong contender if you've never been/have something to celebrate, or just simply want to enjoy life!

Atmosphere is awesome- definitely choose the patio option if the weather is nice. We ordered the shrimp pepper pot and it's super good, but not spicy so don't let the description deter you. I had the trout almandine which was fabulous, I highly recommend if you're a fish person!! My husband ordered the beef stroganoff and it's the best I've ever had. Will definitely be back!!

El Chorro has become our family celebration venue and the place I go with out of towners. it is a lovely setting and usually excellent food. But I had the worst filet mignon I've ever had there our last visit. It was very overcooked and dry and extremely chewy (I ordered medium). When I say worst, it may be the worst I have ever had at any restaurant. So disappointing!  I will go there again but not sure I'll take visitors there -- and I definitely will not order a filet.

El Chorro was deemed one of the best places to eat in scottsdale. So when I was planning my trip I knew I had to add it to my itinerary, and boy was I not disappointed. We decided to go for happy hour on a tuesday night and they place was not busy at all, which is totally fine by me. The appetizers and happy hour drinks specials were so well priced we decided to try quite a few things on the menu. The fish tacos were quite possibly the best I had ever had, as well as the sliders. The tuna poke was also incredible. We did get the lightly battered and fried shrimp and calamari, the dipping sauce was good which helped the slightly chewy seafood. I'm picky when it comes to margaritas, and they margs here were spectacular! Our server, Christina seemed very experienced and natural. We ended getting the sticky buns to take home, but they were a little too sweet for me . Over all this place had a terrific ambiance. Be prepared that you may not get to enjoy the beautiful sunset view if you go for happy hour because they have specific seating for happy hour dining. Love!
Food was fine.  Service was really slow and unresponsive.  Maybe there were understaffed.  We eventually got what we asked for but had to wait and wait for it.

Last week our daughter had her wedding at El Chorro Lodge and the team at El Chorro, led by Lindsey Rendon, did a fantastic job.  The meal began with a crunchy salad and the famous sticky buns.  Guests had a choice of Center Cut Filet, Herb Roasted Chicken or a Polenta and Vegetable Napoleon - all were delicious.  The service was smooth and unobtrusive which was appreciated as there were speeches, songs and toasts.  

One of the nicest touches was the care they gave to the bride and groom by assigning a staff member to take care of them from the time the service ended then throughout the evening.  This special person brought them drinks and appetizers while they took photos with friends and family and continued the great service through dinner and dancing.  

The venue itself was beautiful.  The ceremony took place outside on the lawn overlooking Camelback Mountain, followed by a cocktail hour on the patio, then on to the reception room.  

A very warm and sincere thank you to Linsey and the El Chorro team.  Signed a very happy MOB.

We dined at El Chorro on a rainy night so we did valet mainly for the umbrella. I was told by the greeter to leave it at the front door and upon returning it was gone. We were seated right next to a leaky roof with a constant patter, very distracting.  As they staff tried to fix the issue right in the middle of dinner service. Service was very slow as servers are busy with big parties that are also saeted in the main dining. I was charged for 2 soft drinks when all I did was switch from the flat 7up to coke, and they brought me diet and we had to flag down the server to get it switched. Apps. were great and the sticky buns good. I ordered the strougnouff and it was full of onions which was not in the menu description.  For 30$, it did not live up to its expectations.  Finally, we were served dessert with dirty dishes still on our table but all we could do was stare at it as utensils were MIA.  Overall, very disappointed!!
Awesome environment, great food.
Great drinks, food is below average and way overpriced. Atmosphere is ok. Not in the top 100 in my book.

One of the best happy hours I've ever had! The outdoor area is beautiful, surrounded by desert landscaping and views of Camelback and Mummy Mountains. The service is friendly and very efficient, with bar and high table set for easy and pleasant socializing. We ordered several items from the happy hour menu: crispy chicken livers, crispy shrimp, southwestern poutine, and crudite with hummus - all excellent and well-paired with the red and white wines I ordered. With such good food and wine (for happy hour, the bites were $5 per dish; wine was $3 a glass) and beautiful surroundings, this place is now my favorite happy hour destination.
In Spanish el chorro technically means "getting the runs" and that's exactly the case .

El Chorro gets 5 stars just because it is an amazing venue. Very relaxed but fun. The crowd is a bit older but that decor and layout make up for that. Tons of outdoor dining and cocktails areas! And a great wine selection. The staff was also amazing!!!

We had been here before though not recently and never for brunch.  We had a good experience.  Service was attentive enough then better as the patio thinned out.  Our waiter had some delays initially but soon was keeping a close eye on us. He refilled water without a need to request.  I had the huevos rancheros and was pleased though the recipe wasn't what I expected.  My wife had the avocado  BLT and was pleased. The martinis were good though a little overpriced. The wine by the glass was a good selection, a little overpriced.  The valet parking is an aggravation.  It feels like a way to extract a few extra dollars plus tip.  It would be nice to have handicapped places nearby the entrance. No other reason this was not a five star experience.

5 stars based on happy hour alone.
I met up with some friends here the other day so we could all Uber to an event nearby and couldn't pass up the $3 HH wine. The patio bar was beautiful, the HH prices literally can't be beat, and the place seemed to have a great atmosphere. I'm looking forward to coming back when I have a little more time to get a better feel for the place.

The parking lot here is a dirt lot. Keep that in mind ladies when you're picking out your shoes. There is a beautiful fountain as you walk into the courtyard (minus the yard) which is made up of two large patios. We chose to sit outside even though it was still quite warm out because the atmosphere and view outside was much more appealing. They have live music set up on the patio that is to your right as you walk in so if you want a bit more of a quiet atmosphere sit on the patio along Lincoln Rd. 

After we ordered they came out with a relish tray, which consisted of cold olives, radishes, broccoli, cauliflower, celery sticks, carrot sticks and some peppers. The sticky buns were brought out at the same time and were pretty good, but quickly got a bit hard and were almost inedible. We both had a French onion soup which had pieces of steak in it as our starter. It was pretty good, but after I noticed a couple of patrons with the house salad I wished I had ordered that instead. For diner Mike had the pepper crusted sirloin with frites and I had the pork chop with a green chile risotto and green beans. The servings were pretty big so we were definitely not leaving here hungry.  However, nothing really stood out about our meals. Mike commented that he couldn't even taste the pepper on the steak and that the steak was pretty bland. He immediately asked our waiter for some A-1. My pork chop was pretty good. It came with a salsa relish on top. If it wasn't for the salsa my dish would have been pretty bland for the most part as well. The risotto was ok. Lastly for dessert we both had the chocolate cake with ice cream. The cake was a little rich for me so I had trouble finishing it, but it was pretty good. 

The food was ok. However, it's not worth the regular price.  For restaurant week it was a decent deal. The service was great. Our water glasses were constantly being filled and plates taken away in a timely manner. 

Skip dinner here and come and enjoy happy hour at their outside bar and partake in the amazing view.

We went for dinner right at sunset and there is not a more beautiful spot in PV.  The steak and onion soup was delicious and the 6oz filet came cooked to med rare perfection.  Patio heaters everywhere to supplement the 5-6 fireplaces kept us comfortable on a chilly evening.  We will go back for drinks as the lounge was busy  with patrons and live music.  The only knock was the server was pushing items like we were at chili's on "get rid of the meatloaf night".  Casual dress, dirt parking lot, nice crowd, all make for a classy evening.

Went here for birthday brunch and it was beautiful and delicious. The server was very nice and friendly, and the food was delicious. We got the smoked salmon with a toasted bagel and capers. I'm from the east coast and have not found a good bagel since I've moved to Arizona 2 years ago, however this one was perfect! Also, the truffle fries were amazing, especially the sauce to dip them in- I highly recommend them. No bottomless mimosas though, but overall a great experience with a wonderful view.

Yummy! A glass of Riesling and a plate of the pork tenderloins hit the spot. Kudos to the chef! We ordered the chicken livers as our appetizer and those things took me back to the back-woods of Georgia! The barista was very friendly and chatty. I love the new renovations, but would loved to have dined in the old part. The place wasn't crowded, so that section wasn't available for dining.  There is indoor and outdoor seating available. The views from outside are gorgeous! Great place for a romantic dinner or to hang at the bar with the girls.
We were here for my best friend's wedding, and the location and quality throughout the experience did not disappoint!

We loved the outdoor dining experience! Heaters kept us comfortable.  The fires and fairy lights were very atmospheric, and the staff were friendly.  They have a great wine selection, and the food was enjoyable.  We had a great experience, and hope to be back soon!

Last night I went to the new El Chorro. It's nothing like the old El Chorro and it pulled on my heart strings to tour the beautiful, yet unrecognizable, restaurant. Nothing stays the same and I love change, but not when it involves my valley institutions. Soon nothing in my life will resemble my childhood and I will have no attachment to this town. When Avanti goes, that will for sure be the end. Ok, I'm done whining. Hey, I wasn't the only one. I noticed plenty of others reminiscing... they did happen to be my grandparents age, but I guess that just means I'm wise beyond my years. Ha.  

The new El Chorro is incredible and if you knew nothing of the Old El Chorro, you'll like it that much more. It was a last minute idea to swing by for dinner and the place was packed. So packed that we couldn't get a table. I've never been without a reservation and I figured a weekday was a good time to try... think again. Luckily, the bartender (where the old bar used to be) told us not to worry because she wasn't going to turn customers away. She obviously wasn't working there the time my uncle threatened to burn down an umbrella because it was blocking the view... he did tip $100 to the guy for moving it, though. His personality allows him to say things like that without causing anyone to feel alarm... or maybe it was the $100? Anyway, El Chorro lacks nothing in the customer service department.

So we sat, my mother, her ex and me. An odd group of three. He is totally still in love with her, so I encourage these little gatherings. Between the three of us, we ordered the filet, trout, and escolar. All delicious, but I am still saddened by the menu change. No beloved eggs benedict (that was served all day). No chicken livers. No jumbo shrimp (even though it's on their menu). The only thing retained- the sticky buns. Thank God for that.  

Highlight of the meal was when the bartender made some after dinner shots when he overheard us discussing dessert. I asked him, "what are these babies called?" He responded, "wet dream."  Great, I was having a shot called a wet dream with my mom and her ex. Not awkward at all. Actually, it was pretty funny and the shots were deliciously cinnamony.   

El Chorro, I still love you. You're like a relative who got a facelift and although I no longer recognize you, you're still the same inside.

Beautiful grounds. Servers were pleasant and professional. Enjoyed a great meat and cheese platter. I had a shrimp risotto that was flavored well, unfortunately the risotto wasn't cooked properly. For the price, you would expect it to be done near perfect. It wasn't. Atmosphere was relaxing and had ole time upscale southwest charm and decor. Dessert sadly was disappointing, apple pie and fudge brownie. Overall may try again for date night.

Ambiance was beautiful- we sat outside on the patio. There was a wedding going on so the entertainment was aplenty (ceremony was on an adjacent patio, separated by a low wall). We were disappointed to learn the Poutine was unavailable, but the adjacent table had truffle fries, so we got that instead- and they were amazing! The lobster bisque soup was delicious and abundant with flavor as well. I had the seafood pasta- the dish looked impressive, but the flavor was unexpectedly bland; I put a dash of salt and pepper on it which improved the taste, but I would not order that again. Their famous sticky buns (that come complementary with an entree) were phenomenal. Overall the experience was quite pleasant, and I will be returning to try some more of their menu.
Classic beef stroganoff. That right. The over played now a TV dinner dish. But here, the beef is filet mignon. Heavenly noodles and rich sauce. Yum! Try it!

Food is outstanding, albeit a traditional menu, and service outstanding. Braised short ribs w polenta melts in your mouth. We ordered the beet salad w goat cheese to share. It was enough for the three of us to enjoy a small portion. The patio area is exquisite.  My only complaint is that the last two times we've been forced to sit outside as the inside filled up. This time, I had inside seating but we were booted by a client that reserved the entire inside at the last moment (our guess is that it was a very windy evening, so they switched to inside seating rather than take a chance outside). As it turned out, the winds were not bad and we enjoyed the patio but the restaurant really shouldn't alter seating on a Friday night at the last minute. El Charro, its wait staff and the food, are all 5s if not for the snafus we've had twice with our reservations. We will return for sure and hope for a different reservation experience.  (the warn sticky buns they serve before the meal are a real treat, although they don't really go with the dinners, but imagine more of a very old tradition, which is cool)

Finally, I made it back here after a first failed attempt over 8 years ago.  I love, love their happy hour deals, although I had the Lavender Lemon Drop, which was delicious.  The sliders, tacos and brie platter are awesome at just $3 a pop.  I think the margaritas are also $3.  I can't wait to come back and bring my in-laws, I know they will love the setting and ambiance.  Such a beautiful place.

El Chorro is not a place I'll come back to. The atmosphere screamed 60+, I might even say 70+. My first impression was when I sat on the patio and it was covered with pollen. Not sanitary at all. We decided to move the party inside to their community table instead. It worked for our group. We all ordered the El Chorro Margarita that was on their Happy Hour menu. I ordered mine up (martini style). An epic fail. There's nothing worse than a martini with ice chips in it. We were all also disappointed in the drink's lack of flavor. They did have a good selection of food options. The best dish was the Southwestern Poutine. The street tacos were just ok, the soft taco shells could have been warmed up just a tad. We tried their famous sticky buns. Some really liked them, I wasn't overly impressed. The service was terrible. Our waitress kept disappearing. They added 20% gratuity to our bill because of our party size and it was obvious because she didn't bother to try and earn it. We also had a few dirty saucers handed to us. It was just old and southwestern and not the upscale environment I prefer. This place could use a renovation to modernize and help it live up to their website. You win some. You lose some. I give it a 2 out of 5.

When we heard this place had happy hour throughout the week, we thought we might actually be able to afford to go there!

We went on a Sat. at 4pm, we're gen-x'ers with sleep deprivation, so it works ;-) They had bbq pork, cheese, and veggies - free! However, this only lasted about 30 mins. - was good, but ran out fast. We also ordered 2 glasses of white wine - pretty good for house select. The staff is always friendly, and even though we ordered the buffalo burger the next time (eh, pass - too gamey/salty), service is always great.

Not sure we'd ever order many entrees besides apps off the menu again...We actually go because it's close and has great outdoor seating. Is nice when it's cool  out and you don't want to schlep around to find an easy going atmosphere.

I honestly have to say we were so looking forward to our dining experience at El Chorro.
We had a special family/friends dinner planned for a few weeks now and couldn't think of a prettier locale this time of year than El Chorro

We started by ordering 2 glasses of wine a Cab and a Zin. The Zin tasted a little off and we asked to switch it to another glass of Cab.

For appetizers we ordered 1 Caesar salad to split, a Burrata Salad, 2 cups of lobster corn bisque and 1 bowl of lobster corn bisque.

The soups arrived lukewarm, the burrata salad advertised w/ crostini, it came with none

We asked for the waiter....no one came.
I got up to find the manager who said she would send someone right over. She also offered us a free drink or dessert 
We just wanted service. Not looking for a freebie.

The soups were taken away and brought back not much warmer than the start minus the soup spoons. 
The side of crostini for the salad never came
The entrees were now being served.... still no crostini after asking numerous times.

We ordered 1 more glass of Cab to share.... the new waiter didn't know which one we were drinking and took it upon himself to bring us a more expensive glass.

When the bill came we were charged for 4 glasses of Cab not 3 and for 2 Caesar Salads (not split)
Brought this to the waiters attention.  He said he would correct the bill and split in 2

When he came back he brought us another parties bill... which was significantly less.

We pointed this out... and he brought us our bill.
We gave him our  2 cc's 

He brought the bills back charged to the wrong cc's

We finally had to get the manager involved again
She offered us a discount and said she would have to adjust each bill.
She was now at a point of frustration and taking it out on our party.
One member of our party said we should have paid the 'cheaper' bill and left.  This mess is not our fault.
The manager said to our guest 'I'm proud of you'
That was incredibly rude.
She became extremely unpleasant and accusatory 

We weren't looking for a comp, a discount or a free dessert.
We wanted a nice evening out. We wanted impeccable service 

El Chorro was such a disappointment 
We have been coming here since the 50's.  We understand progress, price increases. Etc

We don't understand rude, accusatory, nasty, and condescending.

It made for a very unpleasant evening.

My wife and I took my sons to El Chorro last night for dinner. They are both college football players and full time students so our chances to get together with them is are rare. We were first introduce to El Chorro by my parents 30 years ago and it is our favorite resultant in Arizona and we have been accused by some of traveling from Chicago to Phoenix just to have dinner. 

The night was awesome! The restaurant was packed as usual and we had a 8 pm reservation. We were seated on the patio which we requested at 7;50. Our waiter Leo was awesome! He was super knowledgable about the menu and anticipated our every need. Our food as usual was outstanding. As a starter we had the shrimp pepper pot, outstanding. For our second course we ordered four different items for a good sampling. We had a bowl of New England Clam Chowder, wedge salad, tomato salad and the beet salad. We sent back 4 clean plates. Next the sticky buns, Epic!! As our main course my wife had the short rib with mustard seed infused whipped potatoes, I had the beef stroganoff and my sons each had the New York Strip steak. Everything was perfect from presentation to temperature. Again we sent back for clean plates. The dining experience was capped off with one more round of sticky buns for the men while my wife enjoyed the strawberry shortcake. 

El Chorro is a true 5 star dining experience in a beautiful spotless setting and receives my highest recommendation.

We have been going to El Chorro for over 10 years we are from Chicago.  So when our friends came to visit that was the place we wanted to take them for the beautiful restaurant and view.  Well our/their experience was not very pleasant.  First we were the first person to walk in the door at 4:00 and we were told we could only sit inside or at the one table outside that seats 18 people, so needless to say we sat at that table.  I explained to hostess that we were just having cocktails and appetizers but she stated all tables were reserved.  Ok so after sitting in the sun on the most uncomfortable seats and after appetizers and cocktails we decided we would like to have more food so we wanted dinner.  I went to the hostess and was told we could not get a table.  So mind you the restaurant had many many tables empty all the while we were there (3 hours). So we asked to speak to manager (my husband would not eat dinner at that uncomfortable table/chair) the manager came over and could care less, he stated they had reservations and there is nothing he could do and walked away.  My friends hated the attitude of staff and we were very embarrassed, all these empty tables and we could not enjoy a meal.  So not sure if I can get my friends back there, not a good experience.  Very disappointed.


Well as instructed I did call and did email without any response.

Four of us dined at El Chorro on Jan. 2, 2015.  The restaurant is nicely appointed with a courtyard for outside dining; large bar inside; and a nice open dining room.  I had the seafood pasta dish which was excellent; my wife had the 1/2 order of the New Zealand lamb chops, which was also excellent; another diner in our party had the short ribs, which he thought were excellent; and the other diner in our party had the trout almondine, which she said was outstanding.  Overall, the food was excellent.  The waitstaff were attentive but not overbearing.  Price was moderate +.  I would recommend the restaurant to a friend and we would return.

Great place for happy hour. Arrive as close to 4:00 as you can great selection of $5.00 appetizers and good wine. The Margaritas are tasty but small. Go with the wine. Yes they even have sticky buns on the happy hour menu

Got a recommendation for this restaurant from a friend, and SO happy we came.  Made a reservation to eat on the patio, it was a bit chilly and we were warned to dress appropriately. We got there right at sunset and the backdrop of camelback mountain was spectacular! The whole dining patio was amazing...heaters everywhere, fire pits etc.  it was about 50 degrees while we ate and I never had to put on my jacket.  The food was amazing, the service excellent. Can't wait to co e back!
What a wonderful date night spot! Nice Mountain View, delicious food and friendly staff. Haven't had a chance to experience the happy hour on the patio but it looks like a fun time!

I hadn't been to El Chorro in 7 or 8 years...long before the renovation and was completely impressed!  We met some friends for happy hour on Friday night and it was quite a great deal - $5 sangria, $4 select glasses of wine and free food - sausage and cheese risotto croquettes, tomato/mozzarella salad and a cheese display.  The locals clearly know about this deal, so make sure to get there at 5pm when it starts!

I came here for a pre-Thanksgiving dinner with the almost in laws. We enjoyed happy hour drinks and appetizers on the patio to start, and what a great start it was! We munched on tater tot-like pom fritos and the sausage plate, which came with assorted pickles, mustard and pretzel bread. 
Next we moved into the dining room and our table of choice was next to the fireplace. So cozy! We were all starving so we ordered another appetizer, the shrimp pepper pot. That definitely didn't disappoint! The shrimp was incredible! It reminded us of the mo rockin shrimp from eddies house. Delish!
For dinner I tried the pork tenderloin and absolutely loved it! It was perfectly cooked and bursting with flavor. My man had chicken enchiladas and those were nice as well. All in all, we were more than satisfied with our evening at el chorro, and will make it a point to return for happy hour and dinner more often!

We dined at El Chorro Saturday early evening.  From the staff who greeted us kindly at the door to our server Nate who made spot-on recommendations to Sean the General Manager who treated us as though we were VIPs, we couldn't have enjoyed it more.  
Started with a moderately priced bottle of The Prisoner red wine that was velvety but not sweet or too tart.  Then those delicious rolls!  The house salad was fresh and crisp and the dressing an indescribable delight of bright grapefruit and buttery garlic.
Our entrees were Scottish Salmon cooked perfectly on a bed of orzo and corn.  Also had the braised shortribs ( a house specialty and deservedly so), heirloom tomatos, broasted chicken that our friend said was the most amazing combination of juicy meat and crispy exterior, and the vegetarian dish with polenta and eggplant that our vegan friend found perfect for her palate. 
Desserts - a blueberry handpie, the beet ginger cake as light and airy as Nate said it was, and my favorite, chocolate mousse that was a melange of chocolate flavors and textures that allowed the flavor and not the sugar to shine.
All in all, a terrific experience that we plan to repeat.  Thanks for a great night, El Chorro!

Beautiful setting, good food and service. We recently went for happy hour with another couple and had an enjoyable evening. We were shocked, however, when a waiter came by to ask us to leave because happy hour was over and he needed the table. I would have understood if there were no empty tables but more than half the patio was empty. Bad ending to an otherwise nice evening.

All I have to say is STICKY BUNS! I went to the El Chorro Lodge for the first time last Sunday for brunch. Outstanding! Great service, beautiful location and tasty food. I will certainly be going there again for brunch. I would like to try El Chorro for drinks or dinner. It looks to be a very happening spot.

I could not love the ambiance of a restaurant more. Sit at the bar and the view of Camelback Mountain is spectacular (hope it stays that way after the redevelopment of Mountain Shadows). Was there a few weeks ago on 4th of July. Enjoyed the 5-6:30 pm Happy Hour drink & food specials. Talked to the bartender about some of the history of the restaurant, very cool. I decided to give El Chorro 5 stars, even though I was disappointed in their dry slider buns. It's just too cool a place not to give it 5. Other beautiful restaurants/resorts in the area should take note and also offer awesome happy hours. I love it and will be going back as often as I can.
Delicious food and excellent service!  The ambiance is wonderful.  Those sticky buns are amazing too!

El Chorro revels in location, location plus amazing views. However, flimsy plastic menus and glassware are easily outshined by crystal and service at the Stockyards. Hmm, sticky buns might be a tradition but the historic Wigwam had a basket of diverse muffins, with blue corn and jalepenos. Pardon the comparisons but the historic lodge only has a few peers in the valley. Kudos to the landscaping designers for the desert compacted soils for overflow parking; their commitment to a natural setting is also evident with the electric recharging stations!

More about the food: the vegetarian meal has great flavors and the salads are huge standouts: the heirloom tomatoes and hand pulled burrata salad are perfect.  Overall, the menu comes with large doses of carbs (scalloped potatoes, risotto.) Beau enjoyed the pork tenderloin.

Enjoy your drink at the bar with a nice oversized wine glass in lieu of a modest glass stem on the table. Dining room tables are a bit too tight to enjoy the desert view and ambience. 

Recommendation: Check out bar & happy hour eats before committing to dinner.

Have been to  El Chorro's many times in the past but always outdoors or at the bar. Went with good friends on Xmas Eve and had some of the worst service ever. It's not like they don't know what to expect on a holiday. Everyone had a reservation and the menu was fixed. Nevertheless, the service was painfully slow (we were there over 3 hours). They made numerous mistakes. They couldn't keep our wine or water glasses full. They even claimed to have run out of potatoes. Really!?

You're a Phoenix icon; not a fly by night franchise. Get it together.

Another one of my regular hang outs. Great location, beautiful setting, friendly and attentive staff. The sticky buns are excellent. Feels more like a house than a business, very unique location and set up.
Five stars.
Much improved experience. Great food, incredible service from Brittany. A lovely evening. Much better than our last brunch experience.

Although El Chorro advertises happy hour, I don't think they really want to offer one.  Things have changed.  

Happy hour guests are now confined to one community table , which seats about 10, or the bar.  One cannot sit at the numerous tables on the patio, which the whole reason for coming here.  One can sit at the bar at any restaurant, so there is no reason to come here to do that.  

We decided to leave El Chorro and go to The Vig, which has an excellent happy hour.  We enjoyed it!

We go to El Chorro every time we visit AZ.  Never a disappointment.  Food is outstanding and service is the best.  Our most recent visit included three times to El Chorro.  The outside patio must be the best one in all of Phoenix.  In the shadow of Camelback mountain, we enjoyed wonderful dishes like the ever fabulous trout almondine, lamb chops, seafoods of all kinds and prime steaks. The NY strip I had with a peppercorn sauce on the side was just one of the best steaks I've ever had.  The pork tenderloin is like no other pork dish anywhere.

Can't wait to travel back to AZ and enjoy the best restaurant in the entire valley!!
I was in Scottsdale visiting my sister and was told to try this place out.  Very nice relaxing atmosphere.  Food was fabulous... didn't feel rushed at all.  Totally recommend sitting on the patio!

This legendary place is a beauty that is tucked up in Paradise Valley with an awe-striking view of Camelback Mountain. With history thru the 1930's the beauty of the mansion is magnificent. The patio is huge and I was excited that our group was able to sit outside without it being so hot and take in the beauty of the place and the mountain. We started off in the bar with happy hour. Loved the cheese plate. Loved the sausage plate too. It's ample and enough to share with one-to-three people as a sampling. The bar is busy. It was pretty much standing room only. I waited for the waitress to bring my house marg. when she forgot and reminded her a couple of times. Yet working in the service industry at 39k feet, I am forgiving and I get that! Meh. Wasn't a fan. Pass on the house marg that is priced way above what it should be. My boyfriend got the Pom Fire marg. a mix of margarita/pomegranite/jalepeno. He loved it; but was happy with just one before heading to his usual brew. I could not taste it, despite the desire to, as I am allergic to jalepenos. Bummer. I opted for the seasonal Strawberry Bliss drink and loved that one. It's a mixology of greatness containing champagne, mint sprigs, muddled strawberries and liquor. MMMMMMMM. Blissful.  Again know that these drinks aren't for the budget conscious. A happy hour drink that ranges from $9-13 is not exactly 'happy'. 
Dinner we moved on to the patio. Live music provides an ambience as does the back drop of the mountain and lighting is just correct. Our picks for the night: Truffle fries.. Yum.;Filet 8 oz with Peppercorn. Heaven in my mouth.; Tenderloin Pork. Yum; Sticky Buns. Don't like sweets, but everyone raved over that gooeyness!; A bottle of Pinot Noir. Get ready . Dinner alone will set your wallet back over $250 smacks. Great service. Perfect setting for the desert. Awesome food. Steep price. That being said. You decide.

Sticker buns before dinner?  Oh yes please.  Customer service was excellent, very attentive and friendly servers.  Beautiful space, beautiful view of the Camelback mountain available in some areas.  We had the Chateaubriand and for the price, it was well worth it, the meat was cooked perfectly and the veggies were nice and crunchy!  Plus it came with salad or soup and dessert.  Meat was tender and cooked to perfection.  If not for dinner, the brunch here is highly recommened.  El Chorro has been around since 1937 and has lots of history.  This is a must visit...

I had such high hopes for this restaurant as I was coming in from out of town and a friend who grew up in Scottsdale recommended.  It was a disappointment.  The food was just ok - nothing special.  The sticky buns everyone raved up - did not come out as an appetizer or even after meal treat - oddly came out with our dinner so it was basically over looked.  The restaurant was not crowded yet we were sat at one of the few tables without a view.  My biggest problem was the flies.  They were everywhere and we were seated INSIDE the restaurant not on the patio.  When you go to an up-scale restaurant to celebrate a special occassion, who wants to be shooing flies away from their food.  It was really disgusting and distracting.  For the money we spent to eat here I felt ripped off.  We ate at the Roaring Fork the next night and it was superb so if you are going to be in the area - you should consider alternatives who have better food, better service and a more pleasing environment - don't waste your money on this place.

Great ambiance and service.  Traditional food done traditionally and good.
We had a great evening, really enjoyed the decor, history, views.  Lovely.
One of my favs in the world.  Go, sit outside and enjoy the basics done amazingly well and creatively.

Been doing Easter brunch for years. They have progressively gone up in price. This Easter brunch was embarrassing. 60 dollars per person with a very small selection of food out in the sun with lots of flies. Dessert was like something you would get at a hotel conference. Sticky buns are still a stable and very good. Did i mention it was a cheesy buffet (serve yourself) with a 20 per cent tip added. If i want to, great but very rude to put that on tab. Maybe 18 per cent at most. The servers were the saving grace. Very friendly and accommodating. Will not be back next year:(

I had the opportinity to attend the Easter bruch on April 5, 2005.  Arrive eraly and had a drink at the bar awaiting friends.  The Bar Tender indicated they had 1,800 reservations which immediately concerned me.  The Brunch was equivilent to a standard resturnat buffet with sesert thrown in.  There was no silverware on the table, getting water was a challenge.  The plates were never cleared.  Asked several time for someone to take the plates.  How this place still draws a folllowing is beyond my understanding.

For our last night in Arizona and family obligations over I figured it would be a good opportunity to take my wife to an outstanding restaurant.

I made reservations three days in advance on OpenTable.com and they actually called me the day before to confirm and check whether we wanted indoor or outdoor seating.  Since it had been so cold the last few days we were there we opted for indoor dining.

A little history about El Chorro.  The main building was an old grammar school.  They added on the courtyard, dining area and gardens when it became a restaurant.  It includes their own garden for herbs, produce for the chef.  It also includes several outdoor fireplaces and a bocce court.

For an appetizer, we started out with a small cheese plate which consisted of parmesan, provolone, bleu cheese & brie with cranberries, dried apricots and candied walnuts.  

While we were working on our appetizer out came the famous sticky buns.  They are delicious, not too sweet and definitely worth trying.

For entrees, we ordered the Niman Ranch Pork Tenderloin and the Pan Roasted Duck Breast.  The pork tenderloin came with green chili risotto and butternut squash.  The Duck came with celery root mashed potatoes, pearl onions, brussel sprouts with a pomegranate reduction.  Both were tender and delicious.  Even though having tried Duck previously and not really being a big fan I have to say the duck here was done perfectly and not as fatty as my previous tries.

For dessert, we split a piece of their vanilla cake with carmel sauce garnished with a blackberry and cappuccinos (they were very strong but not bitter as some can be).

This was a perfect way to end our stay in Arizona.  You cannot beat the views.  Next time maybe we will be able to do a weekend brunch and sit outside to enjoy the fabulous views.

On a side note, they even called me the next day to thank me for patronizing their restaurant.  I was very impressed.

I went here with my family for Easter brunch. While I was impressed with the food, I was very disappointed with the service. 

They offered a great brunch - Eggs Benedict, Bananas Foster French Toast, cheese blintzes, bacon, cheese, meats, salmon, salads - it was great. There was a very nice selection. They also had amazing desserts, like a lemon blueberry cheesecake, colorful cookies, and various other small treats like tarts and cinnamon rolls. The mimosa I ordered was perfect! Just the right amount of OJ to bubbles. 

However, our service was awful. Our waitress acted like she couldn't be bothered to come to our table, let alone fill up our waters or get a drink order. I was there for over 45 minutes before someone asked me what I would like to drink besides water. Additionally, when we asked for something, it took FOREVER for it to be brought to the table. I finally gave up trying to order a second mimosa, because I didn't want to wait another hour to get it. And when it came time to pay the bill, our waitress acted like she didn't possibly understand how to split the check. She was very rude and rolled her eyes when we finally convinced her to split it - we just wanted to split it down the middle, nothing fancy. I was really disappointed by that because it was a great experience otherwise, her attitude just ruined it. I will say that the manager walking around was helpful, and without him I don't think we would have gotten any service at all. 

For the most part, though, the atmosphere is great. The outside seating was wonderful and the surrounding area is beautiful - it's very green and well kept.

For my birthday, I found myself struggling between a favorite standby-restaurant or somewhere new... I'm so glad I gave my boyfriend the go-ahead to surprise me with a new place because I was blown away by El Chorro!

We had a rather late meal with some of our best friends visiting us from out of town, making our reservations for around 8PM. When we arrived, the ambiance was already set with twinkling lights, roaring outdoor fires and a beautiful patio. It was brisk and I'd forgotten my coat, but upon being seated, I realized that heaters were keeping the patio quite warm. (Hooray!)

To start, we shared the sausage platter (which was AWESOME) and a shrimp pepper pot. They were each wonderful, and we finished them both! The sausages were my favorite, particularly with the great artisanal mustards they include. We caught up over a bottle of wine, ordered our meals and were surprised when we suddenly got a big basket of sticky buns! (We had no idea that the place was famous for these - we sort of thought someone else's dessert had been dropped off at our table!)

When we were sure they were ours, we dug in and they were phenomenal! A little strange to have between the appetizer and meal because they seem so dessert'y, but who am I to turn down sweet pastries? (Umm, bring it on!) We asked our waiter about the sticky buns, and he gave us the most interesting back story about the restaurant, the Marlboro man and some elephants that he trained using the sticky buns! I have no idea how much of it was true, but it was entertaining and made the restaurant's staple even more enjoyable!

For my main course, I had a seafood pasta that was out of this WORLD. Seriously, if you're a shellfish lover, this is the way to go. It was -awesome-. Our server was kind enough to even bring out a small birthday dessert, which we all shared (and still couldn't finish, as we were so full!) All in all, the food was 5-star, the ambiance 5-star, and the night couldn't have been better! It was the perfect evening with some great friends - thanks, El Chorro!

So much history in this place! When the long-time owner was retiring several years ago, it looked like the place was going to close. A local Paradise Valley resident stepped up to the plate, bought the place, did some reno, and the place is once again a local favorite, and a hit with tourists, too. The view from the bar or outside seating area can't be beat. Ambience inside is nice. Expect an older clientele. It is in ritzy PV, so don't expect low prices. I've only had dinner here once shortly after it re-opened, and it was for a group event. I thought the food was mediocre but maybe they've since worked out kitchen issues.

Anybody who has been to El Chorro raves about the sticky buns. Personally, I don't think they are that great. I've had them a couple of times, and they were just okay - dry and not overly flavorful. They certainly didn't live up to the high expectations. I'm probably the only one that feels that way!!

Been here a number of times for happy hour, which is pretty decent (Mon-Sat 4-6pm) - complimentary sliders, fruit and a variety of hors d'ouevres.  The happy hour menu also has a nice variety of small plates, but you aren't going to find potato skins or fried mozzarella sticks here - this place is high-brow. The grilled sausage trio is good as are the street tacos. The El Chorro margaritas are sooo good; my friend always tries one of the seasonal specialty cocktails and has never been disappointed.

El Chorro certainly deserves more stars then it has! Whenever family comes to town we always go here for their final night. Although the menu is small, everything on it is AMAZING. Waiters are extremely attentive and are never hard to get a hold of. I went for my graduation and it was beautiful. We sat outside by a beautiful fire. Two adorable young hostesses were at the front and led us to the table. Lighting outside is gorgeous. I had the seafood pasta, and wish I took a picture to post. large portion sizes, and as a recent college graduate, I appreciate that more then anyone.

Just got home from another dinner at El Chorro.  I grew up in Paradise Valley, and I have been eating there for over twenty years.  I have always enjoyed the food as I did tonight.  Most every item on the menu is delicious.  I probably have eaten there over 50 times, but tonight may be the last time that I will eat at El Chorro.  One of the main reasons that I enjoy this restaurant is for the sticky buns.  They are the best.  Tonight, while orderings our meals, I told the waiter how much I enjoy the sticky buns and to be sure to keep my basket of them replenished throughout the meal.  He unfortunately told me that now the restaurant only gives each customer one sticky bun with dinner and if I wanted any more of them I would have to pay an additional $12.00 for a small basket of 6 buns.  I almost walked out of the restaurant after hearing that.  The sticky buns and El Chorro are a Paradise Valley landmark for so many years.  Unbelievable.  We did order dinner, with additional sticky buns and some wine.  Our bill before tip was $120.00.  I gave the waiter a generous tip as well.  I just don't understand this absurd policy change in regards to limiting the sticky buns at this restaurant.  When two people spend $150.00 for and excellent meal, why does the management charge extra for a few small sticky buns, when they never did in the past?  I understand this is a new policy that was started one year ago.  I doubt that I or any of my family and friends will be returning to eat at El Chorro in the future.  This happened on a Saturday night at 7pm in the middle of our tourist season in the valley.  The restaurant was barely half full, so I may not be the only person upset with their new policy.
Whenever we are in town, we wont miss going there! Best atmosphere and great foot plus super friendly and helpful service. We really travel a lot, but this is one of our absolute favorites!!!

Wow just wow. We were in town for spring training, this place is awesome. Just wonderful all around. I never thought we would be having Margaritas and Chateaubriand and their Sticky buns! The service was great our server was very knowledgeable of the menu and wine. It was gorgeous view.  It was crazy busy but we didn't expect any less.
Great location with a fantastic happy hour. Most reviews focus on the sticky buns but what beats a 2.75 Stella in a frosty mug?

The sticky buns are to die for! We sat outside during brunch and the atmosphere was amazing. The only thing I would have changed is having our server be a little more attentive, but we came during a busy time.

Always come here for special occasions- generally for the brunch. Morning views of Camelback are spectacular. The buns and bread basket are great. You get several choices of Eggs Benedict ( regular, veggie, smoked salmon, lobster or filet) very filling and delicious. The breakfast menu is diverse however with many choices 

Reliable, delicious and well worth it!

Not many restaurants can have guests wait for an hour and a half for their food and still get a 4/5 five star rating! 

Walking into the restaurant I instantly feel in love with the atmosphere. While spending time in Arizona the last thing I want to do is eat inside, therefore all of the open outside seating was perfect. Our waiter, John was absolutely amazing. He had character that kept us laughing, was very knowledge about the restaurant (both the menu items and the history) and handled the delay in our food very well (the kitchen was understaffed). For dinner I enjoyed the seasoned wild salmon (with steamed asparagus instead of rice) and my tastebuds went crazy. The company I shared the meal with enjoyed the wedge salad, Cobb salad, stroganoff and the soup of the day (clam chowder). The wedge salad was even noted to be the best wedge salad she had ever eaten! Though our waiter John handled the 1.5 delay on our food with poise and class, it was disappointing when there was not any deduction to our bill for the lengthy wait. Regardless, the food and atmosphere was amazing and I would return.

Before you look at the stars and don't read on let me tell you I loved El Chorro I went years ago before it shut down and reopened and i yes i was saddened when i came back.  They kept true to the sticky buns and the relish tray (which truly isn't great but i eat it and appreciate it being there because im hungry and with family which is lovely HAHA, also rolls on request, really on request and they are worse than grands, yes i wish i was joking) but really the new place is better in some aspects!  Its huge and really pretty but the food is not good.  I wish it good and hope over time it will be but the food was terrible and ive eaten good food i got duck it was so bad and  their signature fish dish which we were told that the workers came in on their day off to eat "pan seared escolar" was Eh, i would rather get Sea Bass at a good restaurant like Ocean Club.  I didn't go in like someone expecting to get blown away i expected a good Easter dinner based on the fact ive been here before years ago and enjoyed it so i went in expecting the price per dish to be as good as it was, well its not and its sad because the place is pretty and it looks like horses can get married in the back grassy area (check it out, it makes sense).

Went here on vacation for the view and the ambiance. Extremely pleased at the atmosphere and the food quality was excellent. There is nothing like sitting on the patio and watching the sky change colors. The Sea Bass was cooked to perfection and the filet had a good flavor (not like a steak house, but good).  If you like wine they have a decent selection.

El Chorro is definitely a Paradise Valley staple. It's a great destination restaurant with great desert views.

I'm more impressed with the venue than with the food. Everything is cooked well and seasoned appropriately, but you should expect "old school" food. The menu is fairly dated, featuring things like beef stroganoff and pork tenderloin.

Watch out for the sticky buns. They are seriously delicious. I ate about 100 of them!!!

Pretty amazing location and fantastic service. If you want to impress people from out of town, let them stroll around the grounds, take a seat in front of camelback mountain, and eat a sticky bun. In fact, just eat four thousand sticky buns. They're the best. For me, it's like a basket of sticky buns and eggs and the view. You don't need more than that. 

In fact probably don't order more than that. 

They used to be known for their eggs Benedict. I'm not so sure that's true anymore. My mother's dish came out cold, as did mine. I know this was not the server's fault. Joseph was lovely. He's like an uncle now. I will call him every Christmas. 

But again. We really weren't there for the eggs. We were there because the weather was amazing and anytime is a good time for a sticky bun. And the restaurant itself is a beautiful place. Great for people watching. And I'll mention the sticky buns one more time for good measure. Be sure to eat sixteen of them. You may feel dead ill but it will have been so worth it.

They've done a great job of remodeling and making it feel modern, yet still authentically desert-town appropriate.

Last time I was here was in 1998 - I won't forget because I was in town on business and had dinner with my dad, in order to tell him I was pregnant with his grandbaby. It was a favorite restaurant of my dad and step-mom, and they took me there a few times when I came to town. It never made that much of an impression on me...felt a bit tired. Then, when we came to town last month, I was catching up with an old girlfriend who had just moved to Phoenix. She had El Chorro on her list of places to try, so hubby and I decided it would be fun to go with her and invite my dad.

We all had a lovely evening. The waiters were extremely helpful. I got the trout amandine and everyone else ordered some meat things (yeah meat thing names escape me). The trout was absolutely delicious and everyone loved their meals as well. My dad mentioned something about the sticky buns to the waiter at the beginning and they were brought out almost immediately. Strange before dinner...but good. 

It's pretty pricey so that would be my biggest hesitation. But for food and atmosphere, I'd definitely return!

This is one of the most beautiful places in Scottsdale!!

They have indoor and outdoor seating with great views of Camelback mountain.  I went once and sit inside and it is fine dining and great service. We got the Hummus and veggie appetizer and all the veggies were so fresh!!

The second time we sat outside and it was a little chilly so they brought all the ladies blankets. How nice!

The food is always fantastic here! Very great pork.

This place is expensive, but well worth it for a celebration. It is great for showing out of town guests what Scottsdale is like. They have a beautiful section out back lined with trees where I think they hold events/weddings and such.  

So beautiful! I'll be back again soon!

The worst service every...unfortunately it came from the manager on duty.  I was part of a group, and had to pay as a group or they would not serve us.  By that I mean, we could not buy a glass of wine for CASH at the bar!!!!!  

The MANAGER said, "I mean you are a big group.  And imagine what we would have to do if more groups came??  How would we ever be able to take care of 2 big groups??".  

Wait, what?  Are you not a large restaurant?  Don't you have staff, and various cash registers, and lots of glasses?  Ridiculous.  Neither I, nor any of my friends and family will ever go here again.

Five stars, however, El Chorro deserves more than just lowly stars. 
El Chorro deserves a rating system of a different sort. 

El Chorro, for all its perfection, deserves a rating system using little baby unicorns decked-out in jewels and adorned with splendid colorful pageantry. 
The unicorns would smell heavenly too; a blend of newborn baby and warmed Ghirardelli chocolate.
Under this rating system, I'd give El Chorro the highest rating possible.

From beginning to end, the El Chorro experience was impeccable. 
Service, ambiance, food, and drink; all were flawless.
I even liked the valet for Christ's sakes.

The duck breast was so delicious, each bite had me wishing ducks had more breasts, like dogs. If they did, I'd devour every last one of them.
In fact, the preparation was so perfect with its melt in your mouth texture, I'd have no reservations about eating the bill, feathers, webbed feet, private parts, and quack. I've never sampled duck breast this delicious!

For appetizers, consider the tomato and burrata cheese plate. The cheese is velvety smooth and creamy. The balsamic, thick and sweet, likely from Modena and not Milwaukee. The tomatoes come from their garden; red, ripe and dripping with sweet juicy goodness. In concert, these flavors will excite your taste buds, giving them little tiny taste bud boners.
 
For dessert, try the strawberry shortcake.
The chef prepares a wonderfully delicious shortbread cake, presenting it in a small pond of berry compote.  And in the berry pond, a plethora of fresh berries, feverishly swimming about in an ill-fated attempt to avoid my fork. 
This is a dessert to behold and I strongly recommend you consume it at warp speed, this so you can steal shovelfuls from your dining partner's plate when she's not paying attention.

Probably the best reason to visit El Chorro, other than the aforementioned is the stunning view of Camelback mountain at sunset. Truly remarkable.
I recommend patio seating for the best view.

The next time I visit, I'm bringing a toaster along so I can electrocute myself after taking my last bite.
Mainly because I can't imagine life getting any better than this.

I was at El Chorro for a wedding rehearsal dinner so my review is based on their private dining services and not the normal dining experience.

Upon driving up to the restaurant there is a professional valet that quickly and efficiently gets you out of your car and on your way to a culinary adventure.  

Our wedding party had a large private room off to the left of the main restaurant.  While walking over (on a hot and humid day) I noticed several huge mobile air conditioning units to cool the customers on the patio.  I was impressed by them because it's a thoughtful gesture that I haven't seen in many places.  These weren't the cheap (worthless) models.  They were some serious industrial A.C. units and they felt great.

The area we had was pretty secluded and private (away from the regular restaurant).  It had a great patio for cocktail hour.  The service was friendly and professional.  They were quick with drinks and quick to clean up empty glasses.

The dinner itself was magnificent.  We had a party of ~ 40 people but the service and the food was that of a quaint 5 star dining experience.  The deserts were so good I feared a massive sugar buzz so I had to contain myself (see my uploaded photos).

Overall, it was a 5 star experience.  If anyone is considering having a private dinner here (wedding or otherwise) I'd highly recommend it.

Fantastic!

I have been a LIFE LONG Paradise Valley resident, and have been going to El Chorro the whole time. I can't tell you how disappointed I am. El Chorro used to be the place we went when we wanted the El Chorro experience, and when we wanted a good meal. It looks like it is no longer going to be that place. Ever since they renovated, things have been slipping, now they have slipped so far I'm crossing it off my list. It's sad but it was because of their decisions.

Earlier this week we went in to El Chorro for for my father's 60th birthday. We had left an event and we going there for a drink and birthday dessert. We showed up and sat at the bar, the portion that is outside. First, we were greeted with a dirty bar. There was a bus tub sitting on the bar in front of us (which the bartender moved to the other side of the bar 20 min after we sat down), the back bar was a mess with employee's personal items, bar towels, and god knows what else, there were dirty linens falling out of a cabinet, etc.... The bar was dirty! 

Second, we wait for the bartender for about 2 min. to even acknowledge we were sitting there. He was too busy talking to one of the servers at the service well. When he gave us our menus we opened them up to see what we wanted. But we opened the menus and they fell apart. Instead of getting us new ones, the bartender watched us put the back together for him. We then ordered our drinks and a dessert. The drinks are the only reason there's one star (and maybe the view), they weren't half bad. At least he didn't shake my Manhattan. 

Third, we got our desserts and they were horrible. The brownie sunday. The brownies were either old or a very bad food service product. The ice cream tasted like it was out of a carton, and it had tons of whipped cream. I think they were trying to hide how bad the dish was with all the whipped cream. You're telling me that a place like El Chorro can't take the time to make their own ice cream and brownies. I could have done better in my kitchen if you gave me an hour. It was embarrassing. 

Fourth, my mother was very unhappy about this. I told her to call and tell a manager. I'm in the industry and I know if a life long guest had an experience like this, the manager would want to know about it - so they could try to fix the problem. But, instead of trying to fix the problem, when my mother called, they blew her off. She hasn't heard a word.

I went to work the next day and talked to a few of my friends/neighbors/regulars and they all said the same exact thing. They said El Chorro has been slipping for a long time and they aren't going back any time soon. We are the people that keep El Chorro open, especially in the summer. We are the people that bring our out-of-town guests for a good brunch or good dinner. That's not going to happen anymore. Let's face it, El Chorro is an institution, they are going to be there for a long time, and I hope they are. The views alone are worth going, even if it's a mediocre meal. But, They will no longer be getting my hard earned money. I hope this changes, and I hope they reach out.
