I would love for things to turn around, but my guess is, with this management, nothing is going to happen. We went for my father's 60th birthday, a big family celebration, and we we're very, very disappointed.

Came to an event which allowed me to get the private dining experience.  Food was incredible, and service was outstanding.  Very nice outside patio ambiance.  Lots of room for people, but still managed to keep the intimate feel.

This place is so good. We had the salmon for an appetizer it was good but we filled up on sticky buns soooooo yummmy. I had the eggs Benedict for my BK & enjoyed grapefruit Mamosa. We sat on the patio & enjoyed the sound of the fountain, lushness of the gardens. I felt like I was on vacation even knowing I live in AZ. This is a must do for any special occasion Mother's Day comes to mind.

Absolutely horrible experience!
We were hoping for a nice meal on Christmas Eve, but were terribly underwhelmed.
The Hosts: We were immediately judged based on how we were dressed and given awkward looks. Although we made a reservation 5 weeks in advance, we were placed in a secluded room in the back that was freezing cold. We requested to be seated at one of the many open tables in the main dining room and were eventually moved. We were still placed in the corner! Luckily, the server ended up being very nice- the only positive part of the meal.
The Food: We wanted to split a dish and were charged a 7 dollar split fee that was not listed on the menu- outrageous! Furthermore, the 40 dollar beef ribs were tiny and not even good. The salad was small and very bland and the baked potato was served with limited toppings, including no cheese which was requested.
Post-Meal Consequences: 2 members of our party- both having had the short ribs- had terrible stomach aches following the meal. Something was seriously wrong with the 2 dollar portion of 40 dollar ribs and the sickness caused by the food is very worrisome. 
Conclusions: Do not attend El Chorro unless you want to have bad portions, high costs, rude hosts, and sickness following the meal. There are so many great options in the Paradise Valley area, and it is a major mistake to blow your money and time on this restaurant.
Not only is the happy hour a great deal with a beautiful large outdoor patio, but the grounds offer a great wedding venue with one of the kindest wedding coordinators, Lindsey!

WEDDINGS BEWARE!!! So we have been in contact with the wedding coordination group since January 17th 2012, planning our wedding from away as we live in Ohio, letting them know our plans to be out in AZ the last week in March and planned on getting together to discuss in person. When we got there, the girl in particular was very stand offish and by NO MEANS put a personal touch on the planning. She stood on the patio and pointed where we'd be at for our wedding and did not even have the courtesy to go down to the lawn to show us options for rehearsal and set up. We asked if we could decorate, and we got the comment of "you can decorate a little, very minimal, but NOTHING that would distract our dinner guests" SO...it is very apparent that they care more about disturbing their guests that people planning for their ceremony. We actually had additional people there and received comments from them saying "It felt as if you needed to be careful to fit into their world and to be sure not to inconvenience them" Already bothered by this, we decided to still go through with it has we had exchanged 20+ emails with them, and thought we were in to deep as it was. When we received the contact, there was a 100% PRICE INCREASE!! I immediately emailed them back ad received the "amount of effort, set-up and landscaping costs we incur.  We had some issues at the start of the year that have caused us to raise our pricing.  And we reserve the right to increase pricing" I abruptly asked" in the 20+ emails you could not have let us know this" and we got the ever so nice response of ".  We communicate with hundreds of people each day and we cannot keep track of who has the most current information if it's something we emailed a while ago" REALLY?? REALLY?? Needless to say I was threw with them, and decided to take our wedding party elsewhere. PLEASE feel free to get ahold of me and I will tell you a location where PEOPLE ACTUALLY CARE!!

Difficult rating as I have had very different experiences at this restaurant ranging from very good, 4 star to not so great, 2 star.  Love the ambience of the patio.  Happy hour was disappointing as so many tables were reserved that we end up in a corner and  reserved tables were still empty when we left.  Brunch was good but very slow coming.  Really slow.  I will give it a few more tries.  I do like the brunch menu.

I had my birthday dinner here a few months ago.  Oddly, the weather in March was warmer than it is now.  I digress.  Anyhow, beautiful patio!  Although I would have preferred to sit on the patio furthest from Lincoln, it was closed for a wedding.  Not sure if it's normally open for general seating, but I'm hoping so.

Because we can't help ourselves, we started with both the shrimp pepper pot and the cheese and charcuterie plate.  The shrimp was in a rich, spicy broth, and served with crusty bread.  Delicious and perfectly cooked.  The small-sized cheese and charcuterie was to serve 1-2.  We either got the large size in error or there are some big ass eaters out there.  And I'm one of them, so I can't imagine that this was the small.  But regardless, there was a nice variety of cheeses and meats with all the accoutrements one could need.

Then came the sticky buns.  Dang.  I forgot about those when we ordered two apps.  Ooey, gooey sticky goodness.  But eat them while they're hot.  Once they cool off, it's over.  I do wish these were served at the end of the meal though.  I felt like it was a dessert.  Not enough so that I wouldn't order dessert...that would be unthinkable.

By now, we could have skipped dinner, but I insisted and we opted to split an entree, the seafood pasta.  This is where the star comes off.  We opted to pay the up-charge to have them portion it for us.  You actually get more seafood that way.  But I would have preferred less in the end.  While the pasta and sauce were very good, every piece of seafood in the dish was overcooked...shrimp, scallops, lobster, etc.  For the price point, there's no excuse for that.  I almost took 2 stars off, but I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt that this was the exception.  But it was disappointing enough that while I will gladly return for drinks and appetizers, I'm in no hurry to actually have dinner.

My hubby and I came here by mistake on a Friday evening. For some reason, I thought that this El Chorro was the same Mexican food restaurant that we used to go to in Tucson, but this restaurant was entirely different. The chicken enchilada dish was only one dish on the entire menu that was Mexican.  Oops, my bad! I guess I should've checked with Yelp first to determine what type of restaurant it was, How cool is it that a restaurant reused what was once a girls' school and converted it to one of the most renowned destination restaurants?!

The ambiance was much different as well. It was more refined, polished, and provided a beautiful backdrop of Camelback Mountain. It felt warm and cozy as well, as though we were entering a nestled mission in the middle of the desert. The patio was very inviting and filled with people enjoying good conversation and food under trees covered in warm lighting. Had I researched first, I might've worn something nicer, instead of our extra casual attire. DId that matter to them? No, they treated us very well! Our waiter James was very attentive and made sure that we had no shortage of their famous sticky buns. The sticky buns are so good that they even take orders  "To Go" if you so desire.

We started off with the Pepper Pot Shrimp Appetizer. It was served with rich, flavorful shrimp bathed in a pepper stew that could've been an entree in itself. The toasted homemade bread reached a state of nirvana  in taste once it was dipped in the pepper pot stew mixture. 

We splurged and tried the Chateaubriand meal for two. It came with the most tender, meaty goodness of filet served medium rare  (as requested) roasted in the oven and served with sides of a cabernet type red sauce made from the filet's own juices and also a decadent, creamy Bernaise sauce. Roasted asparagus, carrots, and red seasoned potatoes surrounded this platter of perfection. 

The chateaubriand meal also came with a dessert. We chose a butter cake with Dolce de Leche ice cream. Forget your typical Sara Lee pound cake. This butter cake puts that Sara Lee pound cake to shame! The cake was neither dense nor too light and flaky. The cake's texture was that of a thicker sponge, but the fork cut easily though the cake like butter. The sweet Dolce de Leche ice cream with the cream cheese, and thicker spongy cake complimented each other quite well. 

We were so tired by the end of all this eating that we woke ourselves up with some espresso there and called it a night. After the appetizer, wine, the magnificent Chateaubriand, and dessert with espresso, let's just say our bill was not cheap. In fact, I would definitely call the night done "on a whim" one of those crazy splurges. That won't stop us from coming back for more though! Bravo El Chorro for giving us a wonderful night to remember!

Attended an event here and everything was top notch.
They have a beautiful venue at the back of the restaurant.
Katerina and Amir took good care of us outside, prior to sitting down for diner. Susan was our server during dinner and she was great as well.

Let me say first that the service was outstanding! There was a mix up with my reservation two years ago. Had a reservation booked but then was called that they were closed. Two years ago.  So, Ryan, General Manager, had a note of this and was gracious enough to comp us some delicious sides to go with our outstanding dinner. He came over to our table and apologized about what happened two years ago. Service from Bartendar, waitress,hostess and GM was fantastic. Patio is absolutely beautiful there and the food is delicious. Will always go to El Chorro every time we are in AZ. 
PS. Still dreaming of the sticky buns from there

This has always been one of my favorite restaurants in the Valley. It reflects the feeling of Old Phoenix and it makes you feel like you are visiting your friend's beautiful southwestern estate. Plus, I could probably eat a dozen of their sticky buns in one sitting. When we were planning the wedding and looking for a rehearsal dinner location, we immediately thought of El Chorro. 

They have multiple areas for private parties, the atmosphere is lovely, the restaurant has a lot of character and the backdrop is just stunning with the restaurant being nestled against the north side of Camelback Mountain. El Chorro lived up to expectations! We had about 40 guests attend the rehearsal dinner and we had a combination of an indoor and outdoor event. They set up several tables with nice linens outside while twinkle lights light up the area. We also had the indoor area that had dark wooden paneling and felt like a beautiful southwestern home. 

The servers were friendly, the drinks flowed and the food was simply phenomenal. We had a buffet style set-up with a combination of Mexican food, a meat station, a slider station and french fries! It was elegant comfort food at its finest. I personally think that this is one of the best (if not the best) locations for a rehearsal dinner!

We celebrated our son's 22nd birthday under the supermoon next to a lovely fireplace. Of course it's always fun to start a meal here with those yummy, gooey, sweet sticky buns, although they should finish with them as a dessert. I had the blue crab, ahi tuna & avocado stack with an orange reduction garnish for entree which was perfect in portion for me. The crab was tasty, however, there weren't many distinguishable chunks. Tuna was excellent. Bday boy's tequila jumbo shrimp were indeed enormous as advertised and delicious. Other entrees were standard fare-braised beef short ribs and a roasted pork loin. Lovely little white chocolate pyramid bday dessert with candle topped off a very nice dinner.

The place is beautiful even though we went in the evening would like to go in the daytime as well the lighting is nice the fireplace is a nice touch very clean classy place service was attentive which I'm keen on our food melted in our mouth sticky buns to take home yum!!!! A must for a romantic classy dinner my boyfriend and I were pleased

BEST BRUNCH IN PHOENIX HANDS-DOWN! Went here with a group of girls after church. We had the best view (A-MAZING Patio) and the service was excellent. The Eggs Benedict was fabulous but what really stole the show were the free sticky-buns! The mimosas were a bit pricey- but they were so delectable, I had multiple!  I can't wait to go back with my family sometime soon!

Nice location but that's where it ends. The street sign on Lincoln Dr. would lead you to keep on driving as it looks like a trailer park sign. My Wife and I both said out loud "This can't be it"  Much of the parking lot was dirt which struck me as somewhat odd for a would be "High End" restaurant. I made our reservation 16 days in advance for Valentines day at 6:30 pm. I requested patio seating for our occasion.  We were seated right in front of the entrance to the rear indoor dining area and adjacent to the wait station so it was fairly hectic, (strike one). 
For the event it was a restricted menu of selections. Sticky buns were on the table before we ordered which struck me a little odd but after reading reviews I guess it's "Their" thing. Dessert before dinner. Can't imagine filling up on those when a steak costs a small fortune, but hey. I ordered the Tenderloin cooked medium well and my wife had the Chicken. Sides offered were both of the Seafood nature, Lobster Bisque and Crab Salad, (strike two) We passed on both. My Tenderloin came out cold and way undercooked (strike three.)  I didn't want to ruin the Evening by saying anything so I powered through. It was tiny anyhow so it didn't take a lot of effort. My Wife said her Chicken was delicious.  Fast forward to the next morning. We talked about Dinner over coffee and I said be honest, how did you really like the experience? She too said she didn't want to ruin the evening and that's why she said her Chicken was delicious. She stated her Chicken was bland and that she's had better at Carabbas. I told her my Steak was cold. We both commented on the less than stellar table location even with making reservations more than two weeks in advance. Our less than average dinner was right at $200, with nearly a 70 minute drive one way. So a two hour plus round trip disappointment. 

Also keep in mind this restaurant is immense, my guess is it seats between 400-450 people as I overheard the wait staff say someone at table 89 (on the patio) needed something. 4 persons at each table, that's 356 people on the patio alone, not including the immense indoor seating as well, so if you were hoping for any special attention or treatment, stay home.

I would also like to comment on one completely tacky maneuver orchestrated by the Valet service. I previously mentioned much of the parking lot is dirt, I had just washed my car and decided to use the Valet Service for $6 as I figured my car would be parked in the paved Valet lot. I was right, they parked it right up front. When we returned my car was no longer in the front. They had moved it to the back to make room for the very expensive/impressive cars like Mercedes, Porsche's, Teslas' I know this because the Valet told me. Designed to impress the guests while they wait for their cars to be pulled up. My nice shiny car  showed up with a layer of dust from being parked in their dirt lot. What really disappoints me is that I put up with that crap AND I gave the guy a $4 tip for bringing me a dirty car! The more I thought about it the madder it made me!!

I almost always read Yelp reviews before I take the leap, but in this case I didn't. Their 3.5 stars and $200 for a dinner for two should have clued me in on the experience but I think I, as well as most others, are captured by the scenery and it's Paradise Valley location, and by default rate the meal higher than it should be.

THOROUGHLY UNDERWHELMING

I took my husband to El Chorro this past weekend for date night. This was our first time eating here. A co-worker of mine recommended it and I'm so thankful we tried it. The sticky buns were to die for. Thankfully we got an appetizer (sausage and pretzels) because the main course (pork tenderloin) was pretty small. I'll definitely be back though. We got some sticky buns to go too :)

Happy Hour here is the best, free food & drink specials. Great views & intresting people. Met friends for dinner / restaraunt week, trout was great & service was great. When @ the bar ask for Alec he is great.

This is one of my favorite locations in PV. Located north of Camelback Mountain the bar and outdoor seating area has incredible views of the mountain. I like to sit at the bar or a high top table in the bar area as there is a nice vibe. The Happy Hour is a great way to be introduced to this place, if you have not tried it!

Hadn't been to El Chorro since new management took over.  What a disappointment!  Weekday happy hour starts at 4:00.  Ordered a drink inside at the bar while waiting for my Meetup group, about 30 of us.  Wasn't sure which patio we were meeting on, so I asked my server, she didn't know.  5 minutes later, I ask to close out.  She informed me that since I'm part of a large group it's one tab.  I'm inside, sitting alone, and she refused to let me pay?  Brings a "manager" to explain it to me.  There are 2 guys sitting at the bar.  I ask "Do they get separate checks?".  No, they'll only split it down the middle.  Also, policy is any 6 or more people it's 25% gratuity.  So, bring your friends, just pretend like you don't know each other.  Server gave me lip, so no tip.  That's my policy.  Finally get my check & was charged full price for my so-called happy hour drink.  Maybe that's another wacky policy they have.

Been to Meetups all over the Valley.  Never had this happen.  Our organizer confirmed it all in advance, but El Chorro would rather choke on its policies.  Anyway, I'm glad it did.  Hadn't checked out the Hearth 61 bar across the street at the new Mountain Shadows.  Beautiful!  They welcomed us with open arms, lovely service, separate checks & no lip.

I'm not one to write reviews... in fact the ONLY other yelp review I've written was for El Chorro a few years ago. But after yet another spectacular brunch today, I feel compelled to comment again. The food and atmosphere is much the same as I've always enjoyed, (phenomenal), but what made today really special was the service. Our server Nate went out of his way to make us feel welcome and catered to, and complied with each special request with good humor and quick action. Impressive, as he was also training a new employee, and tending to other tables during a busy Sunday morning. We'll be back to see him again!

A long time friend told me about El Chorro and I was in town and thought I'd try it. We went for brunch. Beautiful setting, very good service by Robert. Food was good, Bloody Mary was excellent (should be at $12.00). It was really hot that morning and portable air conditioners were offered to some guests but not to others. 

I don't get the buns on the poor hostesses. They all look like a bunch of Stepford wives. When I was leaving I heard one of Managers (or whoever) tell one the hostesses she needed to wear lipstick next time. Really?? I wonder if he told any of the guys that. Poor girl. 

I'd return just for beautiful setting but other than that probably not.

It doesn't get much more Arizona than El Chorro, and you can't replicate the experience.  The sticky buns are an AZ classic and a great twist on the normal dinner roll.  You can't go wrong with the steak, always delicious, but the more unique menu choices are also amazing!  Try the lamb or the Stroganoff!  El Chorro is full of charm, great service, and Arizona history!  Don't forget to take a look around and read the amazing history!  Always a favorite!

Visited Sep 2014. Unfortunately we went on a rainy day so couldn't enjoy the patio. Happy hour menu had a variety of choices that pleased our group, namely the fried liver. 

Portions are large and food was good. No complaints. Didn't really blow me away but I will be back for happy hour.

Stopped in for Happy Hour and was very happy with the overall experience. Great decor, great service, and very fair happy hour prices.  We had the flash fried deviled eggs with candied bacon, the El Churro sticky buns, and the calamari / shrimp with cilantro dip.  All of it was awesome, the shrimp / calamari was .. "Ok" .. But the rest was def amazing and at the level of quality expected.  Can't wait to come back for dinner and try that menu.

First visit...And we will be back...
The location is North on Cave Creek road... Lovely, rustic cowboy Arizona feel, small but nice bar.. ..Cozy feel in the indoor restaurant...Reasonable priced drinks..Made very well...I had a Prickly pear berry margarita...Yummy!  Tonight I had the Salmon..Served on Spaghetti squash.....So, so, so good...I will definitely go back to sample other items on the menu...A must to visit...Very good experience....Can't wait to sit outside on the patio in the summer...

Before I came here, I reserved a table for a family of 5 and when I called I asked if they allowed dogs and the lady said "YES" let me repeat that... "YES". So when I got there with my family we were about to be seated until this scumbag 20 year old douchebag came up to us and said "There's no way you can bring that dog in" and I said well the lady said I could bring a dog. And keep in mind that this is a small 10 pound harmless dog. Then the guy looked at us like it was our fault and we did something wrong. It wasn't our fault, it was the 20 year old idiot lady that didn't know the policy. Then they kicked us out and we spent an hour and a half looking for another restaurant. After that, we couldn't find any more places that didn't have crazy drunk people so we ended up going back to the resort. After an hour and a half of driving, we didn't want to eat anymore so we had to starve until we had airplane food at 4:00 AM. I wish I could've gave this 0 stars. This restaurant is just filled with a bunch of idiots that don't have brains. They didn't even apologize to us. So because of those stupid douche bags, our last day of vacation was ruined. THANKS EL CHORO
Typical American restaurant. Flavorless. Not to mention overpriced. Don't waste your money.

NEW CHEF!

We had been visitors before the remodel some years back and never made a visit to the remodeled El Chorro. While I miss the funky dcor of old Scottsdale, I like the updated version also! 

We visited on a very chilly night and after a drink at the bar, my husband suggested we have our early dinner outside on the patio under all the heaters. I scoffed. It's really cold. The hostess suggested blankets. So she pulled out cozy blankets to cover our chilly laps! After sitting at our intimate table underneath the heaters, I really didn't need it and enjoyed the moonlit sky.

Our server was Andre and he was great! Attentive and friendly without being too chatty. My husband had the sea bass and I had the pork tenderloin. We also had the wedge salad. Sticky buns yummy as always! Our food was moist, delicious and perfectly cooked. Soooo happy! Only complaint was that our wedge salad (which Andre had divided into two for us) had too much dressing on it.
Second complaint was that the food was so good, I overate. My pooch is sticking out as I write.

In our conversation, Andre mentioned that there was a new chef in the kitchen when we said how great our food was. Strongly recommend El Chorro.

I come really only for the sticky buns.  The rest of the food is okay.  Not bad, not great.  I think if you came with a romantic date, a nice meal under the stars is well worth it.  With a large group, this place could get pricey for generally American fare that is done better at Lons at Hermosa Inn I think.  Again, try it out for lunch and then see if its worth committing to for dinner.

The atmosphere here is warm and dreamy, the perfect mountainside setting with just enough rustic Southwest charm. I brought a visiting friend here to experience just that, a scenic retreat with a historic Arizona vibe. We were seated in a cozy nook by a beautiful outdoor fireplace with prime views of Camelback. I hope to return at night in the winter, when I am sure the expansive patio comes alive with the glow from fire and string lights. Our server was very passionate and knowledgeable about the property, and encouraged us to explore the grounds after brunch. Snooping around the hidden patios and original casita might have been the best treat of our visit; except for the sticky bun basket of course, which our server never let run empty!

El Chorro is a Paradise Valley landmark.  The outdoor patio is gorgeous, adorned in lights and comfortably heated.  The sticky buns are amazing (and classic).  I had the sea bass catch of the day which was cooked perfectly.  The fish was served atop a sweet potato puree and garnished with fresh vegetables which complemented the fish nicely.  Everyone in my party thoroughly enjoyed their meals.  

Brunch at El Chorro is fabulous.  The Benedict is superb ... as are the sticky buns and date milkshake :)

Not impressed with accommodation in the bar. We had a party of 10 and asked for separate tabs with the automatic gratuity included(prior to ordering) and the server and manager both declined. It's not that difficult to have separate business checks and they would not accommodate--even though we were ok with the automatic gratuity.

Very beautiful grounds, sitting out on patio for evening dining will make you not want to leave. They are known for suggesting you don't leave without tasting the famous sticky buns. Yet honestly, I have very much enjoyed every item I've tried on this menu. You must go during the seasons they are open, as it's not open year round from my understanding.

AHHHH-MAZING

Love the sticky buns! Went for brunch last sunday, service was great and food was even better. I had the breakfast burrito and loved every bite of it! Did I mention the cinnamon Sticky BUNS?!?! Sooooo good!

My sister had a delicious mimosa and some steak and eggs benedict dish and cleared her plate as well! She has been before for dinner and said it was great. They serve cinnamon buns at dinner too folks!

Its a fancy country club feeling kind of place but staff was very friendly. I will definitely come back.

We were invited here for a birthday brunch celebration. A very nice, attractive setting.  

The food and service were exceptional. However we sat outside and I was not happy with all of the flies landing on the food, table and us.  If not for the flies, these would be 5 stars.

We started with wonderful sticky buns that were perfect. Not the overly frosted dough balls with too much cinnamon that you can get at the mall.

All of the food was beautifully served family style

Platters of fruit, Caesar salad, eggs Benedict, grilled vegetables that were undercooked, and trout. Followed by a dessert platter

The only weak dish was the grilled vegetables, which should have been blanched for a few minutes so they would be cooked inside before going on the grill.

Came here on a Valentines Day date to check out their 3 course meal.

El Chorro has been since the early 1900's, but became a restaurant fairly recent.  The place is charming and has a historical past with some nostalgic story behind the scene.  It definitely has some history and an Arizonian feel giving you a homey feel.

For our food were treated with their famous sticky buns while we ordered a bottle of wine along with it.  The sticky buns was to me just warm cinnamon roll.  I wasn't too particularly too sure what the rave was but okay.  For starters my date went for the Dungeness Crab salad and I ordered their Potato Leek Veloute.  The crab salad was nothing all too inspiring, it was difficult to find some crab or avocado among the other ingredients of mango, arugula, fennel, and edible flowers; I think if it was larger in size the ingredients would shine, but would have been more of an entree salad by then.  My potato leek soup was probably my favorite of the night.  Nice creamy texture of the potato soup and whipped beets and mild hint of sweetness.  For our entree my date ordered the filet steak and I shot for the sea bass.  The filet was cooked to perfection and came with a peppercorn demi-glace; overall nothing too spectacular, but good.  My sea bass was well seasoned and came with a fun olive citrus sauce, and whole olives that gave it some texture.  Again, well cooked and the olive citrus was cool.  To finish I ordered the Strawberry Scone Shortcake and my partner went for the Oreo Chocolate Cream Tart.  

To end, service was on top of things and attentive.  The place is lovely and I can see why it would make a great wedding venue, which it is.  Overall, the food was well seasoned and well cooked, but I guess I wanted more whimsical and fun especially during Valentines Day -- Enjoy!

This review is specifically for Easter Brunch.

Ambience: 5 stars - It really doesn't get any lovelier than El Chorro's patio on a warm spring day
Service: 5+++ stars - Seating & flow were planned to perfection, our server & busser were fantastic, the valet was quick and polite.
Food: 3.75 stars - What was served was very good, especially the seafood dishes. However, I wasn't a fan of the prime rib; it had nice flavor but was too fatty. I would have enjoyed more variety/healthier options and I was surprised to see very few spring vegetables. Although I'm not a dessert person, there was a wide selection for every palate.
Value: 4.5 stars - Brunch prices were more affordable than other restaurants of this caliber, we were happy with what we paid. A complimentary mimosa, bloody mary etc. would've made this a 5 star value.

From the minute you walk up to the tree flanked and blooming entrance, El Chorro just feels like the perfect place for an Easter Brunch. Everyone was dressed in Arizona chic; flowy fabrics and floral colors dominated the day as it approached 90 degrees. Despite the full booking, we were checked in immediately and taken directly to our seats - an outside table as requested, fully shaded by umbrellas.  

Right away I was impressed by the attention that had been paid to planning this busy holiday meal. Tables were spaced generously, staff was plentiful, and the buffet was set out in duplicate with multiple entrances and exits.  We never waited for refills or for plates to be cleared, nor did we ever feel rushed.  Our server was warm and personable, she asked my son about his Easter basket and was always on hand for drinks, clean forks, etc.  As we approached the end of the designated brunch hours, buffet dishes were still full and there was no indication that it was time to leave.

My favorite dish was the salmon - delicate, light and lemony. I don't think I've ever had salmon at a buffet where it wasn't dry and overcooked. This was perfection.  Two of the salads were also stand-outs.  The shrimp salad with celery and nuts was creamy without being heavy and filled generously with fresh bay shrimp.  I also enjoyed the interesting slaw with feta, jicama, and some kind of fruit I think? Whatever it was it was bursting with unique, fresh flavor and great texture. The frittata and eggs benedict were also very good if a bit heavy for the heat of the day. As for the bacon - it was delicious.  I know it's hard to mess up bacon but this was thick cut and exceptionally meaty. Yum!  

I have to give a special high five to the El Chorro Bloody Mary.  It's spicy, tangy, cool refreshment - and comes with a meal on a stick!  Balancing precariously above the glass, a fresh, gargantuan shrimp takes this cocktail over the top. Along with huge olives and peppers, the "liquid" lunch could be making a comeback at El Chorro.

Overall, I was very impressed with our brunch at El Chorro. The planning and service were top notch and we felt very cared for from start to finish.

We went to El Chorro Lodge for brunch the other day and what a wonderful experience we had. There are a lot of reviews already written about this Arizona landmark restaurant so here's another review to consider if you're thinking about trying El Chorro Lodge.

Restaurant ~ they have one of the best dining patio's in the metro!  Great views of the desert and mountains, everything is shaded with umbrella's and they have the misters going full throttle this time of year.  There is usually some light entertainment in the evenings on the patio.  The restaurant is somewhat a "mission style" clean lines, exposed ceiling rafters and white walls with some nice art work.  It's smaller inside than what most people might think, so you will most definitely want to use Open Table or call them to make reservations before going.  

Service ~ good servers here. Most of them are very attentive to your needs and very accommodating.  There were a few times we saw some of the servers blast past customers without a "pardon me" while going to and fro to the patio. 

Food ~ WARNING, eater's discretion is advised here!  Yes they serve you  sticky buns throughout the day and they are sooooo good and very addictive!  You'll want to order more but dont!  It will spoil you appetite before you get your main course.  These tasty little buns or goodness will swell in your tummy so just enjoy one (or two) that way you'll have something to look forward to on your next visit.  

On this last visit I had smoked salmon omelet with goat cheese, capers and some other goodies.  It was awesome!  It came with a side of hash brown potatoes and toast.  We also had their Creme Brulee french toast and ordered a side of bacon.  This sounded much better than what it tasted.  They use thick challah bread that must soak for a very long time, for this french toast tasted more like and eggie bread pudding.  The apple wood bacon was slightly over cooked but still tasty.  We also had their  eggs benedict which was delish.  You have your choice of proteins with your EB ~ canadian bacon, smoked salmon, lump crab or beef tenderloin and served with asparagus.  

El Chorro Lodge has a great ambiance, good food and service.  It is what we expected most of the restaurants would be like prior to moving to Phoenix.  This is a great place to go with friends and family.  I recommend dining on their patio for brunch or a late dinner.  Hope to see you there sometime!

atmosphere 4 out of 5
service 5 out of 5 - go Amy although the girls at the front were rude (knocked a star off)
food 5 out of 5 - had the Chateau Briand med rare and it was delightful
parking 5 out of 5
value 3 out of 5- somewhat pricey $120 for the CB

good for special events

I have to say I was pretty disappointed with our brunch experience here. 

Ok class, let's have a lesson. What makes a good, traditional, Eggs Benedict? 

Easy question, you say?

Answer: Nice crispy, toasted English muffin, meat of your choosing (let's go with Canadian Bacon), creamy delicious Hollandaise.

What am I missing, class?

Ah yes, a beautiful poached egg, which bursts when pierced, spilling it's silky, golden yolk. 

Ok so now that we've had our lesson, let's put it into practice. My eggs Benedict was served with three quartered tomatoes, very very very crunchy potatoes with no seasoning and two eggs Benedict. One was completely missing a yolk! Bummer. When our server came over, I told him and he brought out a new one, but the yolk was overcooked. Bummer, times two. My friend also had an overcooked egg on his plate.

For the prices they're charging, we should have had four perfectly cooked eggs and well seasoned potatoes. It's brunch, not brain surgery. 

The space is beautiful, and the server was pleasant, but I won't come back. Too many other places to try for brunch.

We have been going to El Chorro for Christmas for the last few years. It has been a wonderful experience that we look forward to each year. The Christmas experience is a fixed menu with three options, beef, salmon and turkey. The food is "old school " good, the service is great and the setting is fabulous. 

Although Christmas there is fairly new to us, this restaurant has been a Paradise Valley tradition for generations of my family. It has been getting better, too. There are lots of outside patios and hidden nooks to enjoy a drink with your friends and family.

My first time visiting El Chorro Lodge and I was blown away; I went right when the sunset was about to begin and that set the mood. I sat in the dining room next to the large doors that were open to the outside and you could see the outdoor fire pit. I ordered the prix fixe menu of the week and it was the their mussels and sausage in broth with garlic bread, I chose clam chowder for my starter and ended with my chocolate molten cake. Everything I ate was great and the best of all was the chocolate cake it was pure heaven. This place is pricey but definitely worth a visit at least once also it can be more affordable for meeting a friend if your'e just doing drinks and apps. I can't wait to go back.

We had brunch at El Chorro today and it was wonderful. The patio was comfortable with the umbrellas and heaters. The service was outstanding. The food was delicious. I had the creme brulee french toast - it was carb/sugar heaven. Everyone else enjoyed their food. The eggs benedict came out perfect. The BLT looked awesome. The fries were delicious. We will definitely be back.

My daughter's wedding was there recently. I can't say enough about how helpful Lindsey was in the planning and the Service staff was UNBELIEVABLE. Jim, the Captain, was very helpful the whole evening and made suggestions along the way so I didn't have to think too much.  Everything was perfect.  I highly recommend you check them out if you are considering outdoor venues.  You may pay a bit more, but it cuts down the number of vendors you have to deal with and that is worth it -  Lisa
Went to El Chorro with a friend for a lovely dinner on the huge patio.  The grilled shrimp dish was delicious and the service perfectly attentive to every need.  Such a great ambiance and staff.

Went one spring day w my husband.  We were going to 4-5 different 5star hotels for HH.  Just to taste a little of each.  I highly recommend it
This place didn't disappoint.
Excellent food great service the patio is amazing with the views! Truly enjoyed the ambiance of this place!

How do you say customer service. Sometimes an establishment just does everything right, it can be so subtle you don't even see it but when your leaving and feeling so good and relaxed and then you look back and realize everything was just perfect.
Recently went to Cholla with our family, a party of seven plus a baby, the staff just knows how to take care of their customers. At one point we were looking to get another glass of wine when the waiter came almost magically, when asked how did he know , he answered I was watching your glass. 
About the food, simply superb. We had the mussels as and appetizer, and between the seven of us we had fish, Steak, short ribs and more. Everything was delicious. 
The atmosphere was wonderful as we were there for the sunset with Camelback Mountain staring st us.
For a special night you can't beat Cholla.

This place lives up to the hype. Classy and elegant old world ambiance. We came with a party of 7 for my friend's b day and the service was great. Sticky buns are on point. I ordered the beet salad and filet. I out the steak above the majority of leading steakhouses in the area due to the cut of meat and the fact that they don't drown it in butter. Definitely coming back.

Maybe my expectations were super high since El Chorro Lodge is like an Arizona institution, but after experiencing a meal at this restaurant, I can't bring myself to give more than three stars.  Don't get me wrong, it was "A-OK," it just didn't blow me away.

The history of this place dates back to the 1930's and is pretty amazing.  You can read about it on their website.  The outdoor dining area is huge and has great views of Camelback Mountain.  The live music provides for a nice ambiance as well... at least live music when we were there on a Saturday night.  And our meal got off to a nice start with the relish tray and sticky buns - yum!  But the service was really slow and the food was nothing to write home about.  We found it to be overpriced as well.

I'd consider returning to El Chorro for brunch or lunch or drinks or just picking up sticky buns "to go" sometime, but I wouldn't recommend it for dinner.
Hosted a party for 16 people at the restaurant. It was a great time, the food was tasty and the staff was very attentive. Definitely would recommend this place.
We had a superb dinner at El Charro with a lovely view of Camelback Mountain. Our server, Joe, was attentive but not overwhelming. The food and service were perfect.

Stopped in Christmas eve for a drink at the bar. I had a glass of wine and my husband had a beer. It wasn't crazy busy so don't know why it took 15 minutes for the bartender to serve us.  I was then watching the bartender pouring drinks. At one point, he poured maybe a half shot of vodka into a glass and the bottle was empty. Instead of opening another bottle, he shorted whoever ordered that drink.  The final thing that made me realize this place was a rip off was when I was handed the bill for two drinks at the bar is that they unilaterally charged gratuity. I would NOT have given him that amount because I was not happy with the service. Will never go back.

I brought the family to El Chorro last night. It was my wife's birthday. Great service and terrific menu 
The Halibut special was great and two members of our party had the braised ribs which were superb 
Robert our waiter was most attentive and really made the night. He is very personable and kept just the right amount of attention to the table 
Great history beautiful outdoor seating 
You need to check this Paradise Valley treasure out for sure

Went to El Chorro last night for dinner with my boyfriend and my mom that is visiting from out of town. I have been SO excited to try this restaurant since moving here, but was sadly disappointed.

The waiter we had seemed as if he had better things to do and was rushing us the entire time. When I come to a restaurant like this with prices like El Chorro I expect the staff to be patient and able to appreciate the process of "fine dining". He would ask a question and then before you could answer would start to walk away that I had to call after him for a glass if wine. Water glasses were refilled once the entire meal and he didn't take the opportunities to add on to any of the orders.
The meal:
For dinner we had the Filets and the spare ribs. The filets were cooked well (medium rare) and were tasty. My boyfriend felt his was something we could have made at home in our Crock Pot, so that was disappointing for the price. 
When the food came out we realized the waiter had ordered 3 filets and the short ribs  (for three people??) that we then had to wait another 10 minutes at the end of the meal for the opportunity to flag him down to remove the extra meal (that the food runner had said he was going to take off since he showed up with four meals). 

Lastly, at the end of our meal we were told only the special dessert option, when asked if he had other options he acted again very annoyed but got menus and returned. We ordered two Strawberry shortcakes and the brownie sundae. Again, as he started rushing away after hearing the food options we had to call out to him to ask if they had coffee. I thought the offer of coffee and/or tea was pretty standard at any restaurant.... But who knows! The shortcake came out with a nice presentation, but the lack of strawberries for a strawberry shortcake was mind boggling!! So it was like 5 slices of strawberries and strawberry syrup which also does not represent their description of "fresh strawberries". The brownie was good, though as my boyfriend said, "it's hard to mess up a brownie."

Needless to say I was very disappointed with this place and will not be back. The food was alright but the service or lack there of doesn't make the price worth it!

The best service I've ever had, Denise was amazing. Very knowledgeable on menu items and gave great insight into the history of the restaurant and surrounding area, as well as just overall great conversation. The food was equally amazing, with the Michelin chef making incredible organic, from scratch dishes. Will go back every time I'm in Scottsdale.

What a great place for happy hour! Still not cheap but very reasonable. For 3 of us the bill was $61 + tax/tip. That included a craft drink and a draft beer not on the happy hour menu. And we didn't go away hungry by any means. We had poutine, fried shrimp, crispy chicken livers (2), vegetables w/ hummus, crispy cheese curds, beef sliders, and 3 glasses of wine. Happy hour seating is limited and was pretty much packed while we were there. The facility is beautiful. The service was very good. I would like to go back for brunch, while not inexpensive it would be a good chance to experience a different part of the restaurant. As a majority of the seating seems to be outside, spring and fall would seem to be the best time to visit.

El Chorro is my favorite spot for Sunday brunch!  I ordered the omelette of the day, served with potato cake/hash browns, roasted tomatoes and a giant english muffin, the best breakfast I've had in a long time!  Not to mention their complementary sticky buns.  As if that wasn't enough, the atmosphere is unbeatable!  Shade, misters, and an exquisite view!

Sticky buns are very good. Bloody Mary excellent. Wait staff very attentive and friendly. The Cobb salad was nice except the chicken was really tough!  Overall the food was good and the brunch menu had a nice selection. My only complaint is regarding the hostess station. 

Extremely rude young brunettes who refused to seat us until our elderly parents came hobbling in. I'm pretty sure in the hospitality industry you learn that making eye contact while considering a patron's presence is important. We had a party of 8 and a reservation. We were not asking for special treatment, just to be seated before the old folks and their walkers and oxygen tanks arrived. 

If I'm paying $20 for a salad, I expect not to be treated as though you're doing me a favor by seating my party at our reserved table.

Yes yes yes ..... I was so sorry I forgot about this place for years .... finally a date took me there a week ago and wow the food on point the outside seating was lovely .... can be very romantic... or there where other tables with groups of people ...check it out

I came here for brunch today. What a beautiful patio with a wonderful atmosphere. Perfectly relaxing for a Sunday morning. The sticky buns they bring to the table are delicious. I could have just eaten those, but I did order the huevos rancheros.  They were pretty good but I was more impressed with the eggs Benedict my friend got. I would like to come back sometime for dinner. I'm sure the patio is beautiful at night.

This place recommended to me by a few Phoenix/Scottsdale locals while I was in town for work. So glad I ended up there! The outdoor seating area is beautiful. Our server was friendly and gave some great advice on the dishes. The salmon was outstanding and my colleagues also loved their choices of the braised short ribs and the beef stroganoff. The sticky buns are delicious. Highly recommend this place and will come back.

We're going to meet a bunch of friends there for a meet up group ....apparently you guys didn't want us. I guess that's what "upscale" means. 

The  front desk gal even told me it was being moved to Camelback which was not true 

we went over to hearth 61

Kind of a shame it was my first time there and I really like the landscape and ambience ...drink prices were good would have liked to have stayed and enjoyed myself there

Over priced and the food is highly variable. Had a fish dish that was one of the best things I have ever eaten, and a vegetarian dish that was worse than dirt. With the respect to the latter comment I am being unfair to dirt. Call me traditional, but I would prefer consistency. Service was great, but did not make up for the poor food.

First time being back to El Chorro since the remodel a few years back and it has really opened up the outdoor seating areas and added some great views to the place.  The sticky buns are still spectacular. Our group had the cheese platter appetizer and it was delicious.  Salads were fine but nothing special.  Main dishes were generally OK but on the plain side.  The roast chicken was very bland.  The Beef Stroganoff was good but underwhelming.  The steaks were the best things ordered.  I general, just nothing special was had that made the meal memorable.  Had Blueberry Pie for desert and the theme of adequacy continued.  For the money and from past memories I was expecting more...maybe my expectations were too high.

I dig their lavender lemon drops! The sticky buns make you feel like your grandma made you a special treat. My husband Joe loooooved the trout almondine. It's a gorgeous view, the sunsets are breathtaking. Love it! Make a reservation just in case because it's popular with locals and vacationers.

Based on online photos and online reviews but not an in person visit, I recently booked El Chorro for a group dinner hosting some VIP clients and crossed my fingers. The private dining booking contact, Katie Roberts, was very professional and on top of all details leading up to the dinner, and the evening of, the venue's ambiance and food was a Huge hit with our Sales team and clients. (And given how often our Sales guys are out at restaurants, their high praise isn't easily earned). If you're looking for a great venue to wow your staff or clients, you can trust El Chorro, and Katie, to provide a memorable experience!

Cannot go wrong here. Outstanding steaks, wine and wait staff. The lobster mashed potatoes and mac n cheese are a must have. Portio.n size makes it great for sharing for those like me who cannot decide. 

Beautiful view of north side of Camelback. Mtn from outside dining. Cool bar. 

Only regrets are we have not made it for Sunday brunch yet but will and they are not 30 minutes closer.

Went in for a late night dinner and was received graciously. We sat outside in their beautiful courtyard - one of the nicest outdoor spaces in the area. They are very accommodating with huge outdoor air conditioners and even offered us some natural spray to ward off any possible visiting mosquitos!  

I thoroughly enjoyed my order of their corn and lobster bisque and mussels. It was a perfect late night meal along with their amazing sticky buns - of course!  I little dessert before the meal never hurt anyone, I'm guessing and they were scrumptious!

Living up to the hype is far from the reality! The atmosphere was well done and beautiful to their credit. The food, menu and average age of customers was pre-vietnam. The experience started with us receiving OJ that tasted concentrated @ $4 a tiny glass. The second was the Americano I ordered, still had fluids from the cappuccino machine cleaner. I was unimpressed with the place and wonder what they will do in the next 10 years.

Great atmosphere and location, very average food, nothing unique or appealing in the menu. Missing orders, dishes missing parts of it, nothing to rave about.
Never again.

This establishment needs a serious attitude adjustment.  Nothing makes up for service this bad but adding insult to injury is their slapping on a 20% gratuity (for a party of 6) when 3 of the 6 entrees ordered came out wrong, they ignored a food allergy, had run out of 3 of their house specialties of the day and took 45 minutes for the wait staff to figure out who had our table.  After electing to go to the bar to order a bottle of wine for the table, glasses arrived with no wine?  At the conclusion of the meal we asked to speak with a manager (which took another 15 minutes) and the most they could offer is to remove 2 of the entrees off the bill.  For the prices they charge and historic reputation it wouldn't have killed them to comp the $200 tab.  Let's talk a moment about the "famous sticky buns", they used to be when a hot, full basket would arrive at your table...now they count them...6 people, 6 buns (you get the picture) and refills will cost you and what is with the extra "fillers" in the basket?!  Sticky buns are sticky buns, leave the rest of the junk out as guessing every basket is returned with those remaining.
Bottom line, If you want the "privilege" of paying $22 for Eggs Benedict and $16 for an Omelette of the Day (as previous reviewers commented (no substitutions) I suggest you go elsewhere, anywhere else.  Then perhaps come back for a glass of wine and the views.
Take the time to read other poor reviews...in every instance the Manager attempts to comment and correct the wrongs but the same complaints are listed over and over again.  They are obviously doing nothing to improve their service.  
I have been a resident of Paradise Valley for 20+ years and have loved El Chorro and brought many out of town guests, friends and family there.  Sad to say, I will not be returning.  I hope The owners are reading some of these reviews.

El Chorro has been in the valley for decades. This is where the wealthy old tourists and snow birds dine for a good meal in a beautiful setting. 
The patio is wonderful, very old west/desert sky elegant. The drink menu is creative and original and changes frequently. 
We ate here with a group of 9 and they were able to accommodate us easily. The watermelon gaspacho was interesting and flavorful and spicy. The steak was cooked near perfect for my taste and the au gratin potatoes were off the hook. 
The wine list is expansive, many bottles in the $40+ range all the way up to several hundred dollars. 
The service, while attentive, is very casual. Don't expect starched shirts and formalities. 
The clientele as I stated is typically older, our table by far was the youngest in the restaurant with mostly 40 somethings and a few 30 somethings. Expect a lot of Tommy Bahama shirts and Rush Limbaugh conversations. 
We dine here once a year or so due to the ambiance and good food. It is rather expensive so we like to keep it as a treat. 
You can't really go wrong here for a nice meal.
Great food lace for a celebration lunch.  Our service on the patio was great.   Service inside does not seem quite as nice.   Views are great.

Tucked away in the town of Paradise Valley, this place is a local legend.  It was one of the first places I visited when I moved here a couple of years ago.  Since then, we come here every once in a while to meet friends for drinks or to entertain people from out of town.  The Better Half and I enjoy the "Southwestern" decor and atmosphere here, but it's done in an upscale & classy way.

When we dine here, my fav menu items are:

9 oz Filet, $41
Truffle Fries, $7
Scalloped Potatoes, $7

I try not to come here when I'm super hungry because the Filet is only 9 oz.  It's very good and the portion is just right for a normal hunger level, but it's kind of small for a big appetite night.  The Truffle Fries are amazing and the Scalloped Potatoes are delish....but filling.

We enjoy sitting outside here.  They keep their exterior furniture very clean and it's comfortable, especially during the Fall & Spring.  The building & complex is huge....I guess they can do fairly large special events here.  The only special events I've attended here are business mixers or industry cocktail events....but I've heard it's fantastic for weddings, anniversaries, and reunions as well.

The service here is great.  Nice employees who are friendly and accommodating work here.  There's plenty of parking in the back or a valet service if you choose to use it up front.

Return Factor - 91%

Had a horrible experience there with a group of friends.  We were  told by the manager we couldn't save any seats next to us for our friends that were on their way from work.  When I said to him that if that's the case, we wouldn't be able to meet there again... He said "I really don't care.".  Extremely rude waitress, as well..automatic tipping, or she would not have been so well compensated.
My husband and I have dinner there occasionally.  He's a Vice President of a Phoenix based corporation and will no longer be bringing guests and associates there.  After many years in the Valley, goodbye to El Chorro!
The best brunch we have had in AZ. Even their scrambled eggs are better than any I've ever had. Adorable patio too.
My Wife and I continue to come back to El Choro year after year.  We celebrated our 25th Wedding Anniversary with friends at El Choro. It is our favorite place to celebrate !!  Love it !!

I have been coming here since 1975, when our company would have our monthly breakfast forecast meetings here.  I heard it re-opened and wanted it to come and compare it with the original.  I figured if it was almost as good, it would be pretty nice.
First, the minuses.  It is overpriced.  The menu did not have the shad roe and eggs that it was somewhat known for.  The sticky rolls were nice, but they hardly gave you enough.
I started out with the Cobb Salad.  There were very fresh ingredients on the salad and the ingredients were seperated so you could mix as you wish.  The dressing was Green Goddess or some form of  and it was on the side and very nice.  I also had a taste of the Eggs Benedict at the table.  This was another signature dish and did not disappoint.  El Chorro to was known for the best Eggs Benedict on the planet for years.
The atmosphere here is second to none.  The view of the mountains from the patio is tremendous from the old Spanish surrounding.  
I highly reccomend this restaurant to anyone.

El Chorro is a beautiful upscale restaurant in the heart of Paradise Valley. Generations have been coming there for anything from Sunday brunch to a drink at happy hour.

My family usually only goes there for Thanksgiving and Christmas. This Thanksgiving was another wonderful experience. Great food, great service and a beautiful setting. 
Holiday lunch/dinner is a set menu with your choice of a beef, turkey or fish.

Since it was Thanksgiving I opted for the turkey dinner served with all the traditional accompaniments; mashed potatoes and gravy, stuffing, green beans and of course cranberry sauce. Also included to start out is a relish tray of mixed fresh veggies, a bowl of candied fruit and nuts, El Chorro's famous sticky buns and your choice of soup or salad. I chose the Waldorf salad to start. 

Everything was fantastic!  There was also a choice of three desserts at the end but I just didn't have room so I took my pumpkin pie to go.  

Ron was our server. What a nice guy! He made us feel so welcome, we didn't feel rushed (El Chorro is very busy) and he had a great sense of humor. We hope to get Ron again for our Christmas dinner. 

Reservations are always a good idea at El Chorro and an absolute must for a holiday. I recommend making reservations at least two months in advance for Thanksgiving, Christmas and Easter. 

Enjoy!

This restaurant is beautiful. We live in PV and go all the time and will continue to do so.  The servers are amazing/very professional and I love the food. I'm only giving this star rating so that some consistent problem areas might get fixed:  The food runners at the bar just abruptly "drop" your food (sometimes you appetizer and dinner within within minutes) and, if you ask for something like a condiment, it's unlikely you'll get it from the food runner. It's also difficult to make eye contact with people behind the bar to ask for what you need, so we usually just figure "do we eat the food hot, or do we wait to get what we need and eat it cold."  Also, I don't know whey this happens, but the bar runners put trays of dirty dishes on the counters or just below the counters where you can see them while you are eating, and by  mid-evening, they are much more interested in inventory and closing up than seeing if you need anything. The bar has gotten much better than it was a few years ago, but still needs help, and it would be terrific if these issues were fixed.

We went for Father's Date as this was my husband's favorite place to brunch.  He loves the atmosphere, the view, the sticky buns, and the Bloody Marys.  We went with our daughter, son in law, and grandson.

Unfortunately, we were not totally happy with the service and the waiter, or the food.  The waiter seemed to be "hung over" as he didn't have much of a personality and didn't seem to really want to be there.   

 My husband ordered the special $6 Bloody Mary but didn't really like it.  He loves the one with the giant prawn in it and if he was offered that option, he would have certainly had that.  There was no mention that the bloody mary would not have the prawn from the waiter, but we should have expected no prawn since the price was cheaper than normal.   I had a glass of Veuve Clicquot after asking for the champagne/wine menu.  The waiter brought it over but there were very few bubbles and seemed flat.  At $15 a glass, one would expect lots of bubbles.  It seemed the bottle was left over from the night below.  We sent that back and another glass of champagne was brought out which was more fitting.  

My smoked salmon was tasty and wonderful, as usual.  Hubby and son in law got the special benedict with crab and filet tenderloin.  I didn't ask my son in law if he enjoyed his meal, but my husband said he should have order the regular eggs benefit as the beef was dry and tasteless.  Our daughter had a bagel with cream cheese and avocado which she was very happy with.

Maybe because it was Father's Day, the food, drinks, and waiter were "off".  Because we enjoy the El Chorro Lodge, we will be back, but probably not for any special occasion.

One positive was the woman who was refilling the water glasses (blonde, glasses).  She was very nice and personable and engaged our grandson in conversation.  We all agreed that we would have loved to have her as our wait person instead of the one we had.

We were turned on to this place by some friends of ours that suggested we go for restaurant week. It was really really great and I am glad we decided to give it a try. We got a spot on the patio which was absolutely stunning! We were seated right away and the staff there were very friendly. The restaurant is actually quite large and they have a lot of patio seating which I was surprised about.

The meal started with a lobster bisque which was delicious. They also brought out some sticky buns which was a little odd for the beginning of the meal but nonetheless they were good. My husband and I both got the fillet, I got mine with a crab cake and loved it. The steak, mashed potatoes, and asparagus were all really great however, I did not care for the spinach. Lastly, for dessert we got the tiramisu and strawberry shortcake which were delicious.

I would absolutely love to return here and try some of the other items on the menu and to enjoy the great ambience of the patio.

I still love El Chorro but can't say it's quite what it used to be. Kind of pricey, which you would expect given the neighborhood, but not a lot of value even so. Very average service. I've been coming here for years and will probably keep doing so, I just hope they get some of their old charm back.

In terms of costumer service, this place definitely gets 5 stars. Some of the friendliest wait staff we have ever had! They brought us blankets and an extra heat lamp so we could sit outside! 

The food was probably worth a ranking of 3.5-4 stars in my opinion. We went on Christmas so there was a special menu. The lobster bisque was not great, as here was no real lobster in it and they put too much sour cream, giving it a sour taste all together.  The other option on the christmas menu for a starter was a pear salad which was also just so-so. 

The salmon was great and it came with root vegetables hat were all cooked well and complimented the salmon nicely. 

The desserts we tried were the apple cobbler, cheesecake and chocolate orange cake. The cobbler was the favorite and the other two were just okay.

Great ambiance, scrumptious food. Pretty sure our waiter was jonesing though, he was really strange about talking to us or not talking to us and didn't offer me a dessert menu but just brought me a white chocolate mousse for my birthday. Guess what, I hate white chocolate. He just said "oh don't worry I have something for you" and brought it out. Last, his hands were totally shaking when he boxed our sticky buns and had really scary dark eyes and would disappear for long periods while we waited for service...
Awesome beautiful patio, lovely food. Great service. We always enjoy our time there. Great for special occasions
The Bloody Mary is a must with the jumbo prawn hanging out. Also the eggs Benedict two ways (steak & crab) was insane! Just go!

Wonderful view of Camelback Mountain.  One of the reasons I love this restaurant is the ambience, whether your with a group of friends sitting by one of the fire pits outside or on a romantic date for two this place is sure to please.  1) you have a great view, 2) the wine selection is impressive, 3) the food will tingle your taste buds.  What better way to enjoy dinner than outside by the fire, with a great view.  There service is on point, their serves are educated about the food and their lengthy wine list.

We decided to go here for my birthday dinner since neither of us had been.  The patio seating was beautiful & it was a nice night, so that was a bonus.  Our waiter was very nice & our water glasses were consistantly kept full.  Another bonus was the gluten free menu.
We ordered the artisan cheese & charcutrie plate to start & it was very good.  We decided to split the tomato & burrata salad, which was wonderful despite the stems being left on the tomatos, seriously, who does that?!?!
I'm not able to have anything with gluten, so I was not able to try the sticky buns, but I'm told by my mother-in-law that they were heaven (we took them home to her).
My husband ordered the Rocky Mountain Rack of Lamb and said it was good.
Now, for the bad part...I ordered the 6oz Center Cut Filet with a baked potato & I was VERY disappointed to say the least.  My steak had a very odd, almost rancid taste & it was terribly dry.  My grandfather was a cattle rancher so I know good beef & I hold very high standards for beef & this fell very short.  My baked potato had absolutly no flavor whatsoever, even after drowning it in butter & salt (I'm quite sure my blood pressure jumped a few numbers & my arteries closed a little because of this).
I was given a free White Chocolate Mousse Cake for my birthday which we could barely eat because it was SO sweet.  I wasn't able to eat the oreo cookie crust, but my husband tried it & said it did help with the extra sweetness a tiny bit.  I do appreciate the thought though.
The patio seating, appetizer & the salad made up for the rest of the meal, but I can honestly say that I would not return here unless it was for drinks on the patio.

This place was amazing! Gorgeous setting, wonderful service and everything we had from sticky buns to chateaubriand and the beet salad and the cake and even the coffee were perfectly prepared. Can't wait to go back! N

Great vibe and the place to be for a nice dinner out. The patio seating is beautiful on a nice evening. The food is ok but the price is a bit high for the quality. My shrimp were over cooked and the crab cakes were thin. Presentation was nice. Service was friendly and prompt, but I'm not sure if they knew their menu and wines well enough to make good recommendations. Big selection of California wines on the menu. I hear the bar seating and happy menu are great. That's probably where you'll get more bang for your buck.

This was my first time here. Service was great. We had the truffle fries, beet salad, house salad and the seafood pasta. All the food was excellent. Portions are not huge, but just the right amount. With the free cinnamon rolls we enjoyed every bit!!!

Setting is gorgeous, though I still prefer the "old" El Chorro versus the "new" renovated El Chorro.  While the views are still outstanding and the patio beautiful, service was decidedly lacking and the our dinner selections fell completely flat.  Disappointing and for the price this restaurant charges, I expected much better.  We'll be back....  but for cocktails only!

Came here last weekend for my boyfriends & his dad's birthdays & it was great! The ambience of the whole place was really nice, its tucked away in paradise valley, north of Camelback. I wish it was warmer outside so that we could have sat on the patio. We started with the raved about sticky buns, SO. GOOD. We got them as an app but I would recommend them for dessert :) but then again, I would eat them whenever, they were that good. Then for my main course, I got the salmon, my boyfriend and his dad split the Chateaubriand for two & his mom got the pork. Everyone was very satisfied with everything. I would definitely come back here. It is a little pricey so I would save it for a special occasion :)

Happy hour on Thursday was delightful. We sat outside at a group high top table. Everyone so friendly and happy to be there. Our waitress was so great, no rush, but drinks and food arrived quickly. The atmosphere and people watching was fun, too.
Great french fries and sliders. Thanks for a fun night.

Went to El Chorro tonight and while the the food was really good, the service was lackluster. Our waitress was not very attentive and disappeared for long stretches. Our initial drink order took forever and she didn't seem too interested  in our dining experience. One of the runners brought our charcuterie board appetizer and when I asked what was in it he had no idea, seriously?? Honestly I doubt we will be back with so many choices in the valley.

We decided to hit El Chorro again for Brunch.  Man, oh man, what a way to start a day!   

I had the Best of Both Worlds Eggs Benedict which is one bennie of Jumbo lump blue crab cake with tomato salsa hollandaise and one bennie of petite filet with barnaise sauce, along with a side of roasted potatoes.   The crab cake bennie was delicious, huge portion of crab - much more than I expected.   I've never had a steak bennie before so this was a new twist for me.  I loved it, and the filet portion was again a little larger than I expected for a brunch dish at this price point.  Great flavors, great meal.   Had a great bloody mary as well, although I do prefer a little less horseradish.  They had a special on sparkling wine and my wife ordered a bottle of Chandon bubbly which we both sipped off of, then they graciously stuck a regular wine cork in the bottle for us to carryout.  Our server was awesome - super attentive and friendly.  

Their patio is so money, definitely the place to be.  Misting system in full force, lots of umbrellas and of course great scenery.  It was quite comfortable, and we had yet another great experience at El Chorro.

I'm extremely disappointed in El Chorro  after tonight's special dinner for my mother's birthday turned out to be a regret. After being seated we ordered drinks, 25 minutes later and being told at least four times that my drink was coming, I find out they cannot make an Appletini and have to order something else. This was shortly followed by being served hard, Old tasting sticky buns, which was a major selling point for them. Still I reserved judgement, that was until I got my over-salted beef stroganoff and waited another 20 minutes for my second drink. After hearing that the experience was lacking, the server abruptly went to get the manager as if we had upset him in some way. The manager, Ryan then comes over to the table, pretends to listen and gives a generic  insincere apology accompanied by the gesture to make things right and ensure we finish having had a great experience. This by the way did not happen. He did nothing, no discount to the bill, gesture for a future visit or even something as small as dessert which would be a minimal offer after spending over $200. Overall this was a disappointing experience especially on what should have been an enjoyable and memorable day for my mother. Poor service was giving from the start and followed up with over promising and under delivering. Sad to say but I have removed El Chorro from the list of restaurants I would recommend. Note that I heard this restaurant is under new management which way be the reason why both quality and service have gone downhill. I have eaten here many times which is why this is even more disappointing

A couple friends and I went here after a Yelp event the other night.

The server we had was super nice, and attentive. The food was good, although I was surprised that theyre catogrized as American food. With a name like El Chorro, and given the decor I was expecting mexican food.

I was very surprised by the decor. Again, judging by the name I was expecting it to be darker w/ a lot of rich colors and western pieces. the western pieces were there but it was more akin to what I imagine a resort in Cabo would look like. Very bright and open w/ lots of white and blue accents. I actually told my friend that Id love to have their bar chairs in my (dream) kitchen.

I cant wait to have a drink on their huge, gorgeous patio when it gets cooler.

Never having been to El Chorro before I was excited when my work announced that we would be having our holiday party there this year. It turned out to be a great choice.

We are a decent sized company so we had a room to ourselves in the back of the property. It looked like it was a room that could be used for wedding receptions or any other kind of party. There were several large round tables set up and a full bar in the back. There was an outdoor area too but it was night and kinda chilly so everyone stayed inside for the most part. Another plus was that there was plenty of parking. It's not always easy to find ample parking for a group of 100+.

The evening started with passed hors d'oeuvres that were delish - prosciutto-wrapped scallops, crab-cakes and an onion tartlette of some kind. Whatever it was it tasted good! The staff was very friendly and accommodating to our group.

For dinner I had the shortribs which came with a side of beans and potatoes. It was really good. The meat was extremely tender (melt-in-your-mouth-type), cooked to perfection and juicy and flavorful. Shortribs are not a lean cut of beef but it was worth it. I enjoyed every bite.

One person at our table got a very tough tough piece of fish and they had no problem replacing her meal as quickly as possible without hassle. 

Overall, we had a very nice time, the food was great and the staff friendly. I'd highly recommend El Chorro for a corporate party or reception.

I was there with a very large group of friends and they assigned a rookie waiter who had no clue what he was doing. Not his fault I blame the management.  Poor guy had no help with as big as our party was even applebees would have two waiters helping out. Our drinks were always empty steaks came out cold, baked potatoes where brought out after meals were finished. I complained to the manager and he said he would bring out complimentary desserts he said he would cover the table.  We waited and only four desserts came out when there was 12 of us.  extra plates and silverware was brought out until later. Then he left and didn't leave any thing to serve it with. O and did I mention the steak sucked its usually really good here but not today not impressed at all!

Always A+++. Amazing drinks with even better views. The summer does eliminate the wonderful outdoor seating, however the interior is beautiful a cross between ranch and yacht. Try the staycation drink, and expect to have only one...holy moly is it strong. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu but personal favs are the farmers chopped salad, the pork tenderloin and a must is the gooey caramel cake. The sticky buns, what they are known for come as the bread!  Enjoy!!

How do you enjoy dinner outside in Arizona? Outdoor Air Conditioning! Yup for real!  This place earns 5 stars for; atmosphere, cuisine, environment, selection and service!

The setting is out of a movie set. Outdoors is shady, cool, and wonderfully landscaped.

We enjoyed the trout, short rib and pork tenderloin as entrees. Sticky buns began the experience followed with lobster bisque, shrimp pepper pot and a great salad. If you are a Tequila snob, like me, you will have to settle with my favorite, readily available, 1942 as their top shelf selection. 

As a foodie, I am rarely impressed. This place was a solid five stars. Phillip from Iowa lead our wait staff team. He knew the history of the venue, the details of the preparation of our dinner as well as how to politely not interrupt a table conversation. As usual I asked the head waiter to select my entire meal. He agreed and delivered perfectly. Next up...

Double fudge browny Sunday to finish.

Wow!

I can't remember ever writing a bad review but this place is horrible.  The service is horrendous.  We were extremely polite but the server was rude.  We asked if we could get a plain omelette and he said if it's not on the menu you aren't going to get it.  Who says that?  Every time he came back he had another rude comment.  It's not my fault you are a waiter at 45.... sorry bro...go to school like the rest of us.

I have nothing negative to say about El Chorro.  They improved and the food is always good.  Over the years going there has been fun brunch with friends.  I have never had bad service here.  There has been ownership changes over the years and improvements to the property and food. Those darn Bloody Mary's are fantastic.  
If you are from out of town and have not had the chance to stop in, please do.
This along with Lon's Hermosa are two of my favorite brunch spots.  during cooler months when you can enjoy the outdoors, they have fantastic patio dining.

This place really offers it all when it comes to fun, creative dishes with an upbeat outdoor ambiance.  For starters, you can't go wrong with the El Chorro Margarita or Bloody Mary, then throw in an order of SW Poutine Fries and you'll coast right into a plethora of tasty entree dishes.

Wonderful atmosphere, not as rustic as used to be, modernised quite a bit but still with Southwest charm! Very nice indoor outdoor bar and really nice patio area, and the food and service was great.  I give 4.5 stars and a shout out to our waiter Brent! We had chateaubriand for 2, perfectly cooked medium rare and good wine and desert ( peanut butter pie) as well! The classic sticky cinnamon roll for appetizer was awesome!  Live music would have made it a 5!!
