Just had the grapefruit basil smash. Best cocktail I have ever had. My husband had barrel aged old fashion and he thought it was phenomenal as well. We will definitely be back for brunch and dinner.  Ask for Ceasar...best bartender!

We visit El Chorro every year as we must have their famous Sticky Buns. These things rock. 
Anyhow we came for our 11:30 reservations on Super Bowl Sunday prepared for the crowds...nope place was less then half full. Strange, but nice for us. 
Anywho, I ordered my usual here, the Huevos Rancheros.  For some reason it's completely different here each time. It was pretty good, not what I was expecting, but good. Wifey ordered the Bacon and Eggs, sadly had to be sent back because her over medium eggs were an under cooked runny mess. Our Server had the re cooked and came out great. We also decided to split a bowl of the Chili Verde. Glad we did since I poured it over my Rancheros to liven it up a bit. 
The only other gripe I have about this place is the $5 charge for parking. Just odd since they are not in the middle of down town, but out in middle of no where. 
I pull up and the Valet actually says "you wanna pay me 5 bucks now or when you come out?" 
If it weren't for the sticky buns that are there, I would have told him to piss off and left. Just kinda tacky for an alleged high end brunch place. 
But, maybe that's why they were less then half full on the biggest weekend of the year for the Valley.

So beautiful and so thankful for a wonderful experience. Chef Charlie made an amazing dinner of fresh heirloom tomatoes and burrata cheese, a fresh sea bass with roasted red pepper pure. Truly delightful and served with absolute care by John who loves his job! Can't ask for a better experience and a son who loves to make his mom happy!

Limited menu. Cold chicken and undercooked risotto does not make for a good Christmas celebration. 
First wine served was quickly changed into a cheaper quality once dinner came. 
Outdoor seating did not have proper heating. 
And the cats running around eating what's left was not a pleasant sight after dining.

I loved this place when I went! Very old school westerny feeling. The patio was awesome with a great view and I loved what I got. I ordered the salmon which was delicious and also ordered a pumpkin pie martini (it was around Thanksgiving) and that was sooo good. I think about that martini often. I'd love to go back for brunch some time.

Had a friend in town this past weekend and wanted to find a place with great food and great atmosphere on short notice.  I called around to several places, and on a saturday night, I was looking at 90 minutes or longer.  

A different friend suggested El Chorro and I was able make a reservation for 8pm.  The atmosphere is sensational. We sat on the outdoor patio overlooking Camelback Mountain.

Our server Vicky (or Veronica?) was terrific and really made it a fun evening for us.  I highly recommend the Trout Almondine; it's one of their signature dishes and it is to die for!

Beautiful place.  It's like the neighborhood joint for PV.  Service was very good and wines priced decently. The sticky buns are just small cinnamon rolls. Organic Caesar salad was great, the rest of the food was wedding food like and that's about it.  Mandatory 20% gratuity for a party of two though, pretty ridiculous.  

Prob one and done.

Dined at El Chorro for the first time on 3/9 and had a wonderful meal in an exquisite atmosphere. The only thing better than the sticky buns was the fantastic view of Camelback Mountain. Nate, our server, took excellent care of us and his advice on appetizers (Shrimp pot!) and cocktails was spot on. The Moscow Mule they served is also delicious! I'd absolutely recommend El Chorro for any group looking for a picturesque setting to accompany a quality dining experience.

Spectacular!!! The food, the drinks, the service! WOW!!! We started off with the Shrimp Pepper Pot & the Three Sausage plate. Delicious! We all had the filet and we were all very happy! Yum!!! We thought the menu was a bit limited, but the location & feel of the restaurant is truly amazing!

Rather disappointing so, it is a Saturday night at 8pm and they are out of multiple menu items and the menu is already lacking appeal as is. I tried the chicken and it was ok, nothing great. My friend had the beef short ribs which he claimed tasted like a TV dinner. We all laughed and said he was being dramatic...that is until we tried it and realized that it was dry and tasted like a Salisbury steak. The outside patio was nice but def not worthy of a 4 star yelp rating. We should've known better since we called in at 5pm that night and we're still able to get an 8:00 reservation. There are def better eatery options in the area.

Excellent service! I'm vegetarian and dairy-free, which can trip up a place known for their scones and sticky buns. Nevertheless, I got many recommendations from my server on what I could do to customize certain dishes to my diet, and I ended up with a delicious meal of two eggs, potatoes, toast and some greens. Absolutely delicious! Also the view of the mountains is beautiful. Would definitely come here again, although I'm not sure if I would have lunch or dinner options.

A Russian Roulette experience. My wife has breast cancer, and we met friends there before surgery to make the night less scary for us. We chose El Chorro from great past experiences. 

Not this time. We ate on the patio, starting with happy hour. Service started out OK, and deteriorated. This was not a busy night. Midweek, not crowded. Our waitress pretty much disappeared. Food and drinks took forever to get out, we had to ask others to get our server or help us. 

One diner ordered the duck, the duck was raw. I finally got the hostess to find someone to take away this mass of bloody flesh from the poor woman who had to stare at it and smell it.  

I called to complain the next day, spoke with the manager. He listened, said he would have the manager responsible call me. Have still not received a call. 

Go at your own risk. You might have great service or you might have this. This trip was so bad it completely ruined my previous great review of El Chorro. I won't be going back.

The husband and I originally came here for a Yelp Cocktail Society event and decided we should come back to try more of the menu since the appetizers were delicious. I received an email regarding their Christmas dinner, which included Lobster Bisque, so the husband was sold and reservations were made. 

We sat inside, but the patio looked very pretty and inviting with the lights. However, just a tad too chilly! Our server was nice and helpful and while the restaurant didn't seem very busy, the service was a little slow. (People seated after us received their food before us and such. Not sure where the holdup was!)

The husband ordered the lobster bisque and I ordered the salad off the Christmas Prix Fixe Menu as our starters. The husband liked his bisque and my salad was good. Neither appetizer was spectacular but not bad. For our main course, both of us ordered the Roasted Beef Tenderloin with horseradish potatoes. The beef was tender and the potatoes were good. I liked them together, as the beef needed a little extra spice. The beef alone didn't have much flavor/spice otherwise. (The husband wasn't very impressed and had to order an extra side of horseradish.) For dessert, we both ordered the bread pudding - big mistake. Yes, the portion of bread pudding was huge but it was also bland. It wasn't like any other bread pudding I've had before, more like a thick sponge cut in half. I saw other diners order the red velvet cake and was immediately jealous. (I'm a huge desert person and barely ate this bread pudding.)

Overall, the dinner was okay, but definitely not my favorite. For the price, I feel like we could have gone somewhere else and received a better meal overall. 

***Not being factored into the review, but something I wanted to bring up: The husband and I received 2 gift cards from our Yelp Cocktail Event - completely free. This was a very generous offer from the establishment and much appreciated. We were very excited to come back and to use the gift cards. As we were paying for our meal, we had the waiter check the denomination as we were never told the amount on the cards. Unfortunately, one of the gift cards was blank. I understand that they were free gift cards, but anyone would expect them not to be blank. Just a tad disappointing and hope no one else received a blank card as well! Please note, this is not being factored into the review, as I am only basing the stars given on the food and service.***

Had always wanted to come to this Phoenix institution, so when I had the opportunity I went.  Older place but nice with some absolutely beautiful scenery if you sit in the right place on the patio.
It got cold out there, and they put heat lamps on which really helped tremendously.
Nice bartenders, too, but beware the drinks are somewhat pricey at $9 for a margarita which tasted like it came out of the Sauza bottled mix.  
Had the $12 cheese platter which fed more than one of us as they give alot of cheese, crackers, nuts, dried cranberries on it.  That was a nice platter really.
But, all in all, a nice place to go in Paradise Valley, and--when I find Mr. Adequate--we'll be going there as it's verrrrrry romantic in the evening as they turn very few lights on at the tables outside.  Muy romantico...kiss, kiss, kiss!
As Ahnold says, "I'll be back."

We've been here SO many times and usually have a really good experience. We went last night and took a bunch of friends who had never been before and had the most horrible experience I have ever had - potentially at any restaurant. Because of the rain we had to sit at a community table inside near the bar for a group of eight. 

The waitress was extremely annoyed and rude that we were ordering dinner at this table even though that is where the host set us up. One would think she'd be excited to have a big table of adults racking up drinks and ordering full dinners. We would have stayed for more drinks had the service not been so horrible. 

Even though the food and drinks were great, the service was such a turn off that I will definitely rethink coming here again.

Tucked away in the beautiful Camelback Mountains, El Chorro has become somewhat of an institution and favorite of Paradise Valley residents. Operating as a restaurant since 1937, it's garnered a long-standing reputation for a spectacular atmosphere, high-end dining, and even a popular wedding ceremony location. And after reading many of their Yelp reviews, I expected nothing but great things.  

My girlfriend and I were able to be squeezed in for a Saturday night reservation on three hours notice and were absolutely starving by the time we were promptly seated at 8:30pm. The patio itself is gorgeous. On this particularly chilly evening, we were seated directly next to a small gas-fire pit.

Honestly, I'm not entirely sure what went wrong. Maybe it was an off-night with the servers and kitchen staff. Perhaps we were just extending our current run of bad luck with new places. Or, dare I say, maybe this acclaimed little establishment isn't quite what it's all cracked up to be.

Our original (male) server asked us if this was our first time visiting, which we stated that it was. Not that it mattered. He rattled off the daily special and gave us time to decide. After having some time to decipher the menu, a new (female) server came to us and we placed our order.  

We decided to start with their Tuscan kale and arugula salad, which was pretty decent. Containing dried cranberries, almonds, red onion, feta, and a lemon honey thyme vinaigrette, the combination worked quite well together. Unfortunately, it was the only thing brought to our table that was worth a damn.

I ordered a medium-cooked filet with barnaise sauce, while my girlfriend opted for the fire roasted jumbo tequila shrimp. This is, more or less, when things quickly went downhill.  

As soon as I bit into my steak, I was taken back by the fact that it was barely even warm. My scalloped potatoes and vegetables suffered the same fate, tasting as if they had been sitting on the counter for far too long. The barnaise sauce, which was cold, did nothing to help my quest for hot food. I insisted my girlfriend taste my steak, in order to see if maybe I'm just nit-picking for the sake of nit-picking. Sadly, she wholeheartedly agreed with my impressions. As another reviewer points out, I've had better (and cheaper) steak at chain restaurants, which is quite embarrassing to actually admit to considering my intense hatred for chains.

My girlfriend's shrimp, which I also tried, was really no different. Barely passing as lukewarm, it was very hard to make a judgment about its flavor due to the fact that it was cold. I'm guessing the server, who rarely came by to check on us, was distracted and let our food sit out for far too long. What's funny is that in all of our restaurant adventures over the years, there are very few instances where cold food is an issue.

The question is: Do we say something? By this point, it was 9pm and we were both hungry and agitated. Do we really want to wait another 30 minutes for them to remake the food or take it back into the kitchen and nuke it? We decided to just keep quiet.

Looking over at tables next to me, I was a bit confused to see people receiving baskets of their famed sticky buns before being served their actual entres. I assumed the sticky buns were something they'd bring us for dessert. Another table had a giant basket of bread to boot, so I'm not entirely sure how they pulled that one off.    

My Diet Coke was never refilled, despite letting it sit at the edge of the table for a good thirty minutes. I'm guessing they're accustomed to people blowing money on self-serving bottles of wine and champagne. Not everyone drinks, you know? 

When our server finally came back and inquired our interest about their two dessert options, I just said we'll just have the sticky buns. Seriously, people, I don't get it. They're basically just cinnamon rolls - no different than the rolls that you can acquire at any supermarket or bakery. It was only later, after reading reviews, that I discovered that sticky buns are supposed to be brought out BEFORE your meal - not at the end! It's kind of their trademark, as many reviewers mention that it's the very first thing they (unexpectedly) receive. What's sad is that, if I didn't say something, we would've gotten the snub. You'd think if they've had one procedure properly in place, it would be knowing when to serve the item that they're most acclaimed for.

I've said time and time again, if your food sucks and your service is lackluster, then your ambiance, no matter how much people may brag about it, suddenly becomes irrelevant.

Sorry, El Chorro. We know what it takes to operate a four/five star restaurant, and it takes a bit more than a pretty patio with mountain views to achieve that rating.

I see this place as nothing more than a waste of money and a waste of time. Not recommended.

Have you been the the new El Chorro? El Chorro is a Paradise Valley staple, originally built in 1934 and is a unofficially extension to the Paradise Valley Country Club crowd. In an effort to compete with the new, more modern trendy places in the area (BLT Steak, Prado), the restaurant has been completely revamped with a more modern, brighter feel. However, it still is attracting the silver-haired population. 

The food, however, has also received a major overhaul. There are still comfort food options like Beef Stroganoff, or more current ones like the pan seared escolar (soooo good! Please try this, it's one of the better fish dishes I've had in AZ!). My Mom loved the duck, Grandma loved the Mushroom Ravioli, and  Dad loved the Pork Chop! 

Every entree comes with a salad or cup of soup (the Steak and Onion soup is delish!), which is so rare these days for fine dining. 

Great service, better atmosphere, but still not stepping away from the geriatrics, but overall, I was happy to give El Chorro another shot! 

Yes, they still have the sticky buns.... and they are wonderful!

Came in here with two out of town friends for my girlfriends birthday. We decided to try something new and after reading a few reviews decided it couldnt hurt.  We were directed to a nice table by one of the fireplaces and our server couldn't have been nicer. We had a later reservation on a Sunday and were the last table there, but never felt rushed.

The food was excellent. Everything that came out received a thumbs up, including the famous sticky buns. I had a pork tenderloin that was perfectly cooked, and no one said much we were all too busy eating!  Will be back again for sure

yes we came for the sticky buns.

We ordered drinks before dinner and almost forgot about the sticky buns, Our waiter clayton wasn't the best. while he was walking away i said excuse me and had to say it a few times and i finally stops almost out of the room and stands there looking at me. he finally walks back and i asked for the sticky buns. I guess you have to ask for them as they wont bring them to your table without asking for them. We rarely saw him and even the matre d helped us out , she was great.

The sticky buns are as good as everybody says they are.
I ended up ordering the pork loin only because it came with green chile risotto and butternut squash, The best thing on the dish was the green chile risotto. butternut squash was not what i expected and was bad and i didn't care for the pork tenderloin. i would never order this again. i would order the risotto.  

sticky buns 5 star
risotta 4.5
drink 4
pork tenderloin 3
butternut squash 2

My picks:
Derby Smash
Green Chili Risotto
Pan Seared Escolar
Sticky Buns

If you are looking for Arizona charm, this is the place. Every Arizona resident needs to experience this hidden gem.

Thanks Jacquie, Kristy & Tim for continuing to believe in this historic restaurant and landmark!
Eggs Benedict is a classic and they do a great job. The inside is so much more inviting than before the remodel. Great job. Service is very good but a little stuffy. Highly  recommend

Stop It...  Just STOP!!!  The first thing they bring to the table is a basket of Sweet Cinnamon Rolls  and they were moist and DELICIOUS!!! Had the pleasure of going here for dinner last night with our Awesome neighbor and a new friend.  I had the Salmon, my husband had the Opa fish and they were both really good!!!  We had lobster macaroni, scallop potatoes, and spinach for sides. Everything was soooo Yummy!!!

If you live in Phoenix or anywhere in central Arizona , I can't really see how you would end up at the place unless you were staying at the resort up here in lil ole paradise valley. This place is kind of on a island not much going around here but I will say the view. Building and location are beautiful. Of course if you come here everything on the menu is 30 to 40 dollars per item expected . They do ask you soup or salad so remember that extra add cost. But they do offer free sticky buns with every meal and they are very good. Now the salad of the day was , "fresh and wonderful" occurring to the table . I got the clam chowder but I'm to happy with the asking if there was no bacon and bingo there  is bacon. The staff did seem a little busy serving so maybe he was in a rush but I feel minus the bacon the soup was okay. Now on to the main course.  Seafood Pasta was okay just okay. I expected a little bit more but it came out pretty and sauce was good but the lobster was tough man. The chicken plate was just not my cup of tea but rib stack with cheese potato was amazing . Best thing on the table. I have to admit I was excited for the meal but if you have the ability to drive there are better pasta opinions but the ribs were worth the tasting . I would recommend the beef stack ribs , if I had that for my meal, I would be very pleased. If you are able to drive I wouldn't make the trip. But if you want a nice date or group area to relax and drink, this could be nice. It's quite the set up. O i forgot they gave my grandma a happy birthday desert which was a sweet for her but the rest of group that eats chocolate seem to of liked it.

Our family made the mistake of dining here on Thanksgiving. Everything from the table to the food to the clueless and absent waiter was outright below average and certainly no where near the kind of restaurant described in the other reviews (which I wonder now if were written by the owner or manager). What a disappointing holiday.

I came for brunch with girlfriends & sat in the outside patio area since the weather was cooperative.  Customer service was great.  I had a bloody Mary which was pretty good & also had the Egg Benedict with Canadian Bacon.  I thought the food was ok.  Maybe it was just my particular choice which wasn't too impressive.  It wasn't bad though, just to clarify.  I probably wouldn't go back again, not because it was bad but because I am not from the area so I'd probably try to find a better "go to" spot.
We had a lovely dinner here. It is an elegant setting with indoor and outdoor seating. The sticky buns were a nice twist and the filet and salmon entrees were superb. Our server was excellent.

Valet park. The main lot is dirt :(
Food was good and atmosphere was excellent.

El Chorro Lodge is not the place to go for cutting-edge cuisine to tickle your tastebuds, but exactly the right place to go when you want to entertain friends with a unique Arizona experience and no risk of disappointment.  You will find great southwestern atmosphere, a beautiful patio, good service, pleasant outdoor service with great views of the mountains, plenty of  good food for fussy eaters, and lots of history.  And sticky buns.  You won't find uniquely southwestern food, just traditional American fare.

My husbandand I had a great experience last Tuesday night at El Chorro. A bit out of our usual stomping grounds but we had to be in the area for work so we decided to stop in. Our server Stephen was great... he helped point us in the right direction from start to finish. Our favorite's were the Shrimp Pepper Pot and the Trout Almandine. Also, the glass of Rombauer Chardonnay Stephen recommended paired perfectly. Great experience overall.

Atmoshere is a 5 
But we ordered 5 beet salads and that was enough beets to feed a village.  Waiter should gave stopped that. The bartenders at such a fab bar should sone knowledge of basic drinks.  I had 2 of the worst rob roys ever !  And they served another person a Manhatten in a highball glass !food was ok.  No stickey buns.

great atmosphere and service but the food is just average, particularly for the price.  the two-star rating description "meh. i've experienced better." explains exactly how i feel.

my husband brought me here for valentine's day so we could be fancy.  we started at the bar.  Jared was great, Aldo was a wet rag.  we were both horrified that the margarita comes out of a spout behind the bar.  if there was a difference between some canned "house" margarita and a fresh-made one, no one gave us that choice.  the ladies next to us must have ordered every appetizer on the happy hour menu -- they looked good and were reasonably priced but we saved room for dinner.  (mistake?)

dinner on the patio was beautiful -- nice weather, soft lighting, heaters where necessary, love songs at an appropriate volume.  our waitress was friendly and attentive.  but dinner itself was completely unremarkable.  there was a preset menu to choose from and we chose a variety.  for nearly $300 after cocktails, a bottle of wine and tip, i am disappointed that not one food item stands out.  not even the dessert.

people love the sticky buns.  they're fun for sure!  but i have been spoiled by sassy's bakery in east mesa (totally worth the really far drive!)  so to me, that is not a big draw.
Excellent and relaxing place for breakfast of brunch.  Often take people from out of town here and love the history and beautiful grounds.  The food is awesome too.  I always have the Cobb salad!!

Came for Sunday brunch with a friend, and having never heard of the place, really had no expectations.  Upon pulling into the parking lot, I was really impressed by the expansive outdoor seating area.  Decor was relatively trendy with a hacienda theme.  

I ordered the smoked salmon eggs benedict, and it was great.  Eggs were perfectly poached - the yolk ran out all over the english muffin and tasted delicious.  It came with sun dried tomatoes, asparagus and a potato pancakey thing that was pretty good.  The bread basket had the famous mini sticky buns, as well as a moist chocolate scone.

Service was extremely attentive - I think we had 5 different people waiting on us.  It was borderline overwhelming at times, but everyone meant well and was incredibly nice, so overall I'd consider it a positive.

Prices were a bit high for brunch but it was well worth it to sit outside in a quiet, beautiful setting for an hour or two - I'll definitely be back to try El Chorro out for dinner sometime!

We always have a great time at El Chorro! Usually for a family brunch, mothers day or birthdays, but I had my baby shower there as well. The menu selection for brunch is very nice, food quality is fantastic. I have had everything from the French toast to biscuits and gravy. Their yummy sticky buns are served in a basket of baked goodies before the meal. Service can be a little relaxed, but they are always busy, and that has never had a negative effect on our meals. The patio is lovely, views are gorgeous and I love that they grow their own herbs and veggies on the property.

I finally had an excuse to try this place out with my girlfriends for brunch the Sunday after my birthday. I loved the patio and fortunately the weather cooperated so it was not too hot. Everyone really liked their food. The biggest hit was those awesome Bloody Mary drinks with the huge jumbo shrimp. Those were amazing!!

I was expecting a huge tab but actually it is a very reasonably priced brunch. If you know what to order. My friend sitting next to me got the French Toast which was a huge plate and she didn't finish half of it. My sister on the other side had the beet salad which was tiny! Since it was twelve dollars, about the price of many of the other meals, she expected it to be entree size but I would consider it small even for a starter. I had the breakfast tacos which were on the small side as well but very tasty.

Overall, I'd say that it's a great option for brunch and I really enjoyed it. I'd come back for sure just for that bread basket and cocktails.

We have been talking about coming here since I moved to Scottsdale - funny, when I heard the name I thought "Mexican food"! We had a fabulous dinner - food is 5 Stars, venue is great, service good - our particular waitress was "over the top" and a bit too friendly but we'll be back. It was 3 of us so we sat at a table but usually it's 2 of us so we'll sit at the bar.

Made reservations way in advance for Mother's Day for indoor seating.  When I made the reservation the representative told me where we would be seated and instructed me to park in the back near there. When we arrived on time for our reservation it took them over 25 minuets to sit us at an OUTSIDE table even after verifying it twice while waiting. To add to it they sat a group ahead of us who showed up 2 hours early for their reservation because it was all they could book online. Go figure. They got sat ahead of us. Plus we had only 4 people in our party and the gratuity was already added to our bill. Great food and it ends there unfortunately.

Update: I emailed the email address given below almost immediately. It has been almost 3 full days and I haven't received a reply...

Just came back from a week in AZ and ate at El Chorro two times. Brunch was quite expensive and tasty. The Sticky Buns are AMAZING. Our diner a few days later was well worth the price. Great portions and choices, oh yeah and you still get the Sticky Buns.... Yummy

This place never fails! Took momma here for happy hour. The El Chorro Margarita is delicious $5. Just the right amount of alcohol with mix. We also ordered white wine- great pour, as well as amazing service. We ordered The Perfect Storm as an app $10- rock shrimp and calamari pan-fried with a well-flavored dipping sauce. We ate it before I remembered to take a picture. :) another plus was that it came out in less than 5 minutes. Hands down one of my favorite happy hours in the Valley!! View is incredible as well.

I ate at El Chorro during restaurant week back in the fall! It was absolutely amazing! Just the right size portions as well! I was excited to try some new restaurants during Restaurant Week and I cant wait til next year so I can try some more new ones! I loved the cinnamon sticky buns as well! It was quite a surprise to get that before our meal as well, and they were super tasty! I loved the ambiance of the restaurant as well and the patio seemed very nice too.

Great brunch, great service. Our server Grant was especially friendly and accommodating. This will be one of our go to spots when out of towners come to visit. The breakfast food was fresh, not greasy, and delicious!

They serve an incredible brunch spread! I ordered a turkey sandwich with fruit and a side cup of the verde pork soup. Everything was perfectly prepared and delicious across the board. The entire table was raving about their selections. I would recommend the verde soup to everyone as a must try. It was not too spicy and had so much flavor. I usually have a hard time deciding on whether to go sweet or savory with brunch, I always want both! But you don't have that predicament here because they bring out the most amazing cinnamon rolls in place of the traditional bread basket. They were so good! I'll definitely be returning!

We came today for Father's day brunch. We were icily greeted upon arrival by some stuffy unfriendly old lady... they put us in this table by the bathroom probably because we had kids... it is father's day so obviously we would bring the kids to brunch. It wasnt super busy and it felt very dated. The menu is meh
.. the sticky buns and the truffle fries were the only saving points for this place. Service was spotty, eggs werw bleh just eggs and the hamburger was overcooked and the bun was stale. At least give some more sticky  buns to forget the rest of the meal...very disappointing experience...do not recommend

Enjoyed dinner last night with local friends from Phoenix and such a lovely experience. The fish of the night was Sea Bass served on a parmesan risotto with lightly sauted tomatoes with green beans....delicious. My husband had the Trout Almondine and still talking about it. The wine selection was impressive and our server Joseph was very attentive. This place was hopping with a full house and a wedding as well.  Timmy Moore was so very gracious checking on us throughout the evening.  The ambience lends itself for intimate conversation and truly a pleasurable dining experience.  If sitting outside, toss in a light sweater for comfort.

I've dined here for both dinner and brunch. perfect place to entertain and get a flavor of an Arizona setting with it's beautiful outdoor patio. I had an out of town guest and before they left, I thought to make an Open Table Brunch 9:15 reservation for a party of 4. Early because my guest had a flight to catch, but I have to say it was really nice, the brunch crowd wasn't there yet so it was very peaceful and very enjoyable. The service was excellent.

Of course we had classic brunch cocktails: Bloody Marys as we munched on their delectable Cinnamon Buns and assorted pastries while looking over the menu. Entrees ordered: Banana Pancakes (toasted macadamia Nutella fondue sauce), 3 Sausage Omelette, Green Chili Pork Stew, and Best of Both Worlds Egg Benedict (one benedict of each. Jumbo lump blue crab cake, tomato salsa hollandaise, petite filet, barnaise sauce)

All the dishes were hot, fresh, and tasted wonderful. My out of town guest had the Eggs Benedict which looked absolutely amazing and he said it tasted fantastic.

Arizona Landmark with excellent service, Food: very good... just a great place for an early brunch!

Was it the scene, the huge martini, or the company of friends?  Not sure and don't care, I love this place.  Sit outside at a table or at the bar, service was amazing and the night had a hint of cool about it.  I will return.

The setting, decor, and ambience of this restaurant is southwest picture perfect, but that's only a small part of what makes El Chorro rate 5 stars. Our reservation for 4 was honored promptly and we were seated in a lovely corner table near a glowing fireplace. Once we settled in, our waiter Phil let us know specials of the day and took drink orders. He then brought us fresh cinnamon rolls hot from the oven -which were so good they easily could have been dessert. 

Upon looking at the menu we admit to thinking it was pretty boring. Wrong. The choices may have been somewhat traditional, but the presentation and taste were extraordinary. 

Shared salads - wedge and Caesar - were ample and had their own twists to preparation. Each couple coincidentally ordered the same entrees, trout and salmon. It was so beautiful that I wish I had taken a photo of my salmon dish. The fish was perfectly cooked and served with a ginger soy sauce on a bed of black quinoa and braised baby bok choy. The trout was served with green beans almandine and roasted potatoes. We also ordered a side of lobster mac and cheese for the table. All dishes were phenomenal. 

Then came dessert. We shared freshly baked apple pie a la mode and key lime pie, both fabulous.  However, as good as the meal was it was our waiter Phil who helped to take it over the top. Beyond his excellent and attentive service, he had the ability to let us leisurely enjoy our conversations, and know when to step in if we needed anything - and even absconding with the very last piece of key lime pie for us after being told it was sold out! 

It's no wonder this place has a deserved stellar reputation.
Food and service were excellent! Went for brunch and were not disappointed. Sat on the patio and the view of camelback mountain were spectacular
We had dinner here last night with a party of six. Every meal + appetizers were cooked to perfection. The ambiance is great too. We will definitely return!
Beautiful patio and the rest was horrible in a nutshell. We paid $200+ and left unsatisfied. Good for drinks at best.

I call a weeks ago and talk to a hostess about bringing my group to el chorro. They said first it is first come basis on the tables. No reservations. 
  So yesterday i did a get together with my meetup group. There was about 10 of us already around 4pm. We all try to order a drink the waitress said we cannot pay individually especially if big group. If we had more 6 people it will be one check. We were trying pay individually and even wouldn't get the cash. 
  So some of my members try to buy drinks inside the bar and got refused from the bartender to serve us. They said we only can order from the waitress. The waitress was so rude no personality just such a bitch to us she should lose her job. 
 We ask the manager to talk to us he came out and said this is there policy. This is bad! I was there 3 years ago and it was so much better then. I will never go there again it is too bad.

We ate there tonight for my wife's birthday. It was terrible. Manager was going to take care of us and did nothing. So the server with a bad attitude had to take things that the manager promised which was no tip.

Amazing food! I have crazy food allergies and the chef was unbelievable with everything! Not only was the food perfect but the cocktails were great too!!
I ate with a party of 20+ and they loved the food and made me a separate meal for my allergies!
THANK YOU!!

Some of the best food in the valley, I've eaten here many times. Recently I have noticed extremely poor service and it has continued after several other visits their. The quality of service is one aspect of running a restaurant and reflects upon the business. There are many restaurants in the valley that will treat you well. I have hopes that a realistic review will return the restaurant to a wonderful place to dine. Rather than a negative review.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in the Valley. The setting is gorgeous, with a beautiful, large outdoor patio. The inside has sliding doors, so on nice days (or nights), they open them up for a lovely indoor/outdoor dining experience. Food and service are always good. I recommend the flash fried lobster medallions - expensive but worth it. I usually order that for my entree. Sticky buns are served instead of regular rolls with dinner and are delicious. If you're looking for a special place to bring out of town guests, this is the perfect spot.

Would have made 4 stars but my wife and always split a dinner, we spilt  the spinach salad, it was good. They split our filet for us, we asked for medium and we were very specific about it, we asked the server if it was pink in the middle, is said yes but we charge $7 to split it. I said no problem I understand, now $7 makes that steak a $40 filet, I'm thinking it's gonna be good. It was well done and flavorless, we choked it down. 
The sticky buns were not out of this world either.
The guest we went with enjoyed their meal, that is why I gave 3 stars.
If you want the best steak....Ruths Chris rarely makes a mistake cooking  it right....

I have to tell you about the brunch I had at El Chorro over the weekend... 

So good! It literally couldn't have been any better. It was a gorgeous day out to start with and we got to sit out on the beautiful patio. We ordered the Eggs Benedict (a must try!!) and the Smoked Salmon to split, and some Truffle Fries to snack on while we waited for our food. The chef also sent out a giant Shrimp Cocktail for us to try as well; probably the best shrimp I have ever had. Cooked perfectly and a great salsa/cocktail sauce to go with. The Eggs Benedict were absolute perfection. No BS, couldn't have asked for them to have been better in any way; it is hard to paoch an egg to perfection and they nailed it. The Smoked Salmon was very impressive as well; nicely toasted bagel, cream cheese, capers and a light salad on the side. 

You MUST go try their brunch on Saturday or Sunday. Amazing!

Thanksgiving Day.  Party of two.  Turkey, stuffing and mashed potatoes all served cold.  Service slow.  $65 per person was way too much for what it turned out to be.  And they automatically added a 20% tip and then asked for more.

The boyfriend surprised me here for my birthday while we were in town. 

It has good food, great service and a great view. The place is a little overpriced but I would definitely come back especially for the sticky buns they serve instead of the typical bread! 

And we even got to experience our very first sandstorm while we were here too. I would definitely come back if I were in town again.

- Beautiful space, great scenery, the outdoor seating when the weather is nice is spectacular
- The service is nicely paced and well informed
- The food was ok, but not special
- The burrata salad had great burrata, but the tomatoes were too firm and had little flavor
- The charcuterie board was typical, except for the St. George Brie, which was spectacular.  Extremely fatty with a nice aftertaste
- The gluten free menu is somewhat limited, so I had the chicken.  It was tender and savory, but at the end of the day, it was chicken
- No gluten free desserts

The perfect place for out of town guests. If the weather is nice their outside seating is great. Really nice scenery and excellent food. I have tried different omelettes and enjoyed every one of them. The best part is that they give free baskets of their stick buns, which are amazing, to each table. I have never been to El Chorro for dinner, only brunch. 

The price is definitely high, but if you dont mind paying you won't regret it.

This is not going to be a good review. Why?  Because I have been there 3 times and spoke very highly of this place, and from the moment we entered it was a disappointment, not only to me and my husband, but our guests as well. First off it was summer, we normally are in Arizona in winter.  But it was a lovely evening for the patio.  The patio looked quite different, no tables set, no menus, no Ambiance at all.  The hostess was quite rude when we mentioned wanting to sit on the patio. And in her answer of Yes we can sit outside, but she would have to find a server.  That in itself sounded strange.  She could have shared, that to them it's summer and most people want to be inside, but no, she shared nothing but a poor attitude.  So then we decided we were not going to get good service outside and then chose to go in doors. Five o'clock starts Happy Hour, and we were there before 5.  So we sat down.  No one bothered to come to our table.  It's 10 after Five, 10 minutes went by and again, no one.  My husband stopped a busboy and asked if a waitress could come to our table?  When the waitress finally showed up, no apology, and a bit of an attitude AGAIN.  THEN A MANAGER came by and we let him know our feelings.  He came out with some Sticky Rolls as an apology. First off we ordered liquor drinks, Sticky rolls don't go with liquor.  Then we see he returned and gave the table near us the same thing, so no he really didn't care about us either.  The food we always ordered, was Just not good.  We ordered six appetizers to start, everything tasted like it was first frozen, just sad that a lovely place turned so bad in just a few months.  We had just been there in March of 2017 and this was Sept. 2017 was it under new management? New hostess new waitresses Something had to change because the Caring, was missing, big time, and so will we be....

Between one wedding, one dinner, and one happy hour, I overall really like El Chorro.

With the exception of my happy hour visit, service was impeccable. I don't remember his name, but the waiter I had st my birthday dinner was fantastic.

The happy hour menu is awesome. You could easily leave buzzed and stuffed for under $20. Beware- happy hour is only outside or at the bar.

I think the food is good, but not 5 star worthy. I haven't been blown away by anything I've had (save the glory that are the sticky buns), but the food is solid. 

What really makes El Chorro great is the overall atmosphere. The staff are great, the restaurant has a cozy and rustic feel, and the views of Camelback are gorgeous.

This review is only for happy hour. Monday-Saturday 4pm-6pm

Tips:

Absolutely go for happy hour if you can. All of the happy hour appetizers are only $5.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Fried Chicken Liver $5 - I personally love chicken liver and so I liked this dish! I personally prefer the larger pieces so that you get more of the liver taste rather than the breading taste. The bacon marmalade with it is delicious!

Southwestern Poutine $5 - This appetizer is just some thin fries with cheese and sauce on top. I made the mistake of thinking it would be like Canadian poutine with gravy.

Famous Sticky Buns $5 - You get 4 sticky buns, one sticky bun is about the palm of your hand size. These sticky buns are DELICIOUS, I can see why everyone raves about them so much. They are made with a nice caramel sauce/taste with a good amount of cinnamon spread on the inside of the bun swirls. You cannot come to El Chorro without trying their sticky buns.

Margarita $5
wine $3

I absolutely love the decor and atmosphere here. It is like a country club with amazing outdoor seating which is perfect for Arizona weather. The service is great as well, I had a great time at El Chorro. I would definitely recommend coming for happy hour if you don't want to splurge on the high prices of the dinner size entrees.

Meh...  I saw this place on Best Thing I Ever Ate and was excited to try it out. On cue, the free and delicious sticky buns showed up on the table shortly after we sat down. They did not disappoint!  Additionally, there was a little butter croissant in the basket which was also delicious. 

Things went downhill from there. We ordered the banana pancakes and the huevos rancheros. The pancakes were standard issue. Nothing special. The huevos rancheros were trying to be fancy but fell flat. Also they had cilantro in them and I hate cilantro. 

Also the table next to us tried to order the Denver omelet without the ham but were told "sorry no modifications". Really???!  Who does that?  That's just bad policy and customer service. 

Won't be going back.

We had a mixed experience at Happy Hour (HH) and dinner.  Quick summary follows.  

Hits:

+ Food was tasty.

+ Ambiance was nice.

Misses:

- Waitress was never able to bring the "last call" round of HH she offered.  No explanation or apology.  

- Asked if I "minded" anchovies on my salad.  I said "no," but didn't realize there would be an upcharge until the final bill came.

- While in the bathroom, observed one of the staff go straight from the stall (not the urinal) to the Kitchen.  No hand-washing, not even a pause by the sink.  

Buen apetito!

The place is lovely and the happy hour food is good BUT I have been here 3 times and I will  NOT come again! I am sick and tired of all their rules. We are only allowed to sit in certain places, 
not allowed to push tables together, not allowed to move chairs to a table to accommodate more people at our table. The staff are rude and unhelpful. I was  not allowed to have salt on my skinny margherita. The mountain of rules leaves me cold and feeling as though I am a naughty child in school. Sad that they ruin a pretty place with lousy staff and ALL the rules!

Fantastic views of camelback. Absolutely gorgeous location. Beautiful all around. Drinks are great. The lavender lemon martinis was good. The charcuterie board is fantastic! Fried lobster tail is great. The lamb chops are alright. Not the best. I should have gone with the short ribs as the waitress suggested. The sticky buns are FANTASTIC! And the apple pie was also amazing. Couldn't really go wrong and I had a great night.

I've been here quite a few times, most recently I went with a friend when her dad was in town and I was very impressed with the remodel.  The huge outdoor/indoor bar area is very nice with beautiful furniture and delicious cocktails to choose from.  I don't remember which we ordered but they were all amazing.  We then went to our table after a short wait and you feel like youre at some amazing hotel sitting outside, relaxing, with a live band playing and people slowly joining the dance floor (hilarious to watch by the way...good people watching).  We ordered an assortment of dishes -- some vegetables, some mashed potato thing, and I think I got some kind of fish.  It's been a few months, but all I remember was the atmosphere, the food, and the drinks all being wonderful.

El Chorro is a classic. It has the best patio in Scottsdale with great views of Camelback mountain. In March the smell of the orange blossoms fills the air and combined with the spectacular weather makes for an amazing atmosphere. The bar area is great and opens onto the patio so even if you go just for drinks, it will ge a great time.
Food was terrific.  Service was polite until the older gal showed up as our waitress.  Would definitely come again and recommend this restaurant.

Amazing patios and service... Meh food

Visited for the holiday and was stoked about eating at El Chorro. After hearing of its long history, quality food, and sticky buns, my expectations were very high. 

First, the restaurant has an amazing design-- tons of patio spaces with fireplaces, a semi-private grass yard, old-style rooms with all modern amenities, and all while preserving the historic nature and charm. The western theme prevails through the renovated touches. 

Second, the service was top-notch at every turn. We arrived early and they were able to seat us nonetheless. Vicki quickly visited us, took orders, and started to check on us frequently and with an earnest joy. Supporting cast and the waiter from the next table were just as gracious.

Ah, but the food... Our party covered the menu: Lobster Bisque, Arugula Salad, Shrimp Cocktail, Scottish Salmon, Beef Tenderloin, Organic Turkey, Peach Cobbler, and Cheesecake. To the person, all said things were flat on taste. Aside from the sticky buns, nothing stood out. The Bisque was bitter from the sherry used. Salad was par. Shrimp cocktail were well-sized, but standard fare and sauce. The salmon had quality and a great cook's touch on its side, yet left two in our party perplexed by the off pairing with a corn succotash. Two others thought the tenderloin was a great cut undermined by being too raw and being paired with a forgettable gratin potato and completely bland creamed spinach that tasted little like their ingredients. Last, the cheesecake and cobbler were so dull that not a single person of six finished their dessert. And our family craves desserts like Frosty the Snowman likes magic hats!

I'd love to score El Chorro higher. All the pieces are there, except the food. And since it's a restaurant, that's too important to disregard.

This is perfect. 
Really good. 
One of the best fillets I've had. 
Look how easy that is to cut.  
Shut up! 
Is that right? 
Best steak I've ever had. lol.
I'd definitely go here and buy steaks.

Good Sunday brunch! A little pricey but you get a ton of food and it's good. We enjoyed "the chicken and the egg skillet " and the yogurt and granola parfait. The cinnamon rolls are yummy too. We also enjoyed cappuccino. They have a lovely outdoor seating area which would be great when cooler.

Two years later and the food experience is not improved.  Three of us, $250
And no one had even a decent meal.  My wife's trout was inedible with greasy potatoes,  my stroganoff had tons of noodles, almost no beef and was cold.  My draft beer was luke warm.  The space is a five,  the food is a minus five, so I guess a one is the only choice.
Why would anyone waste this great place to serve such below average food?
Get a chef who is not lazy and serve a better than average menu and fare.
Also, at your prices, bring back the relish dish.
By the way, we had an 8:00 reservation and were not seated til almost 8:30,
Cooling our heels in the lobby.
Christina from Huntington Beach was Awesome!! Happy hour was great, we loved the atmosphere..our first time in Scottsdale and at El Chorro..it won't be the last!
We had a lovely dinner on Saturday.  Our waiter, Jeff, was attentive, knowledgeable and made our night out memorable.

Dinner last week - we shared the burrata salad and vegetable Napoleon.  The tomatoes on the salad were hard and flavorless, yet the cheese was fantastic!  Veggie dish: Polenta was cooked perfectly, actually had a creamy texture vs. the typical grainy/corn texture.  Very filling and lovely.

Made a mistake of ordering a decaf Irish coffee -- far from the Buena Vista in SF!  They used whip cream from a can and first time out the coffee arrived lukewarm. 

Nice wine list - enjoyed the Etude Pinot Noir.  

We ate at the bar and servers were generally attentive.  Overall I would give the experience a 3.5 (I know - not available).  A four is too generous given the tomatoes and Irish coffee.

Dinner on patio with friends on March 19 was a first class experience in all respects.  The grounds were beautiful, the weather spectacular and the delicious cuisine paired with flawless service completed the package. Julia ( from Philly), our server , was quite personable and very knowledgeable on the menu, wine pairings and the history of the property. We will request her when we return to this restaurant. (Even though we live 300 miles away) 

I had the locavore beet salad with goat cheese - beautiful presentation and delicious. Entree was halibut with Pasilla chili-lime beurre blanc sauce - show stopper. 

Finished our meal with an expertly prepared cappuccino and a walk around the grounds and appreciated the historical photographs.
Beautiful location, very good service, food is just average besides the sticky buns served prior to your meal.Very pricey for meals. Great view of Camelback Mountain.

Went here for St. Patty's day and loved it! Absolutely beautiful outside, reminds me of Barcelona or Seville. The food is New American Cuisine! It was delicious. I ordered a house salad that was very fresh with chick peas, croutons, and a nice balsamic dressing. I had a veggie burger for my entree that did not fall apart like at some places. The veggie burger was very good as were my fries. They have wonderful desserts too. I was too stuffed to eat the dessert but did have a taste of what my friends ordered which  was some type of  cake with carmel. The service was excellent too. They were busy that night and they did a wonderful job at making me feel welcome. The decor inside is very fun too.

Recently my husband and I went to El Churro.  We were visiting the area and we heard he cinnamon rolls were good.  

Atmosphere;
It's a fancy restuaurant with both indoor and outdoor seating as well as bar.  We sat inside and even though we had reservations, I still felt as though I was sitting on top of other tables.  I would have preferred more room between the 2 people seats.

Food:
I ordered the shaved brussel salad, which was deliscious.  It was much bigger than what I was anticipating.  It was great though and I appreciated it was chopped.

We had asked for a side of the cinnamon rolls but the waitress never brought them out so we settled for the 2 that came with the meal.  The cinnamon rolls are deliscious and I can see why they are recommended!

For my entree, I ordered the sea bass special which came with a few beets, brussel sprouts, and carrots.  The plating was beautiful, but for a special, I would have expected a slightly bigger dish.  Never the less, it was cooked well.  My husband ordered the lamb shank which I enjoyed more.

Dessert:
We ordered the brownie sundae dessert to split.  When I think of a brownie sundae, I think a large dessert but it was a small serving.  If the waitress had informed us of the size, we would have ordered 2.  The flavor was great and I enjoyed the passion fruit in the center.  

Summary:
In all, I liked El Churro a lot and will be back.  I recommend it to anyone local and my personal favorites were the brussel sprouts as well as the lamb shank.

I saw this restaurant on "Check Please" which is a local show on Channel 8 which reviews 3 restaurants on every episode. The food looked really good and I love restaurants with a nice patio and a lot of history, so I thought this place would be a hit. We went there for brunch and the patio was really nice with a great view of Cammelback Mountain. The food was the biggest disappointment. The prices are really high, which I don't mind if the food is worth the price, yet that wasn't the case here. I had the Cobb Salad and the chicken was cold and it was just okay. I was expecting more out of a $15 salad. (FYI - Charleston's Cobb Salad is a-mazing and cheaper!) They also give you a "bread" basket before your entrees come out, and it's more like a "dessert" basket which is cool but the scones and sticky buns were just okay. My fiance had a breakfast burrito which was huge but it wasn't anything to get excited about. Our waiter was pretty stale too... and it had the pretentious Scottsdale vibe to it.

Had really excellent food and service here. We were a big party of people but our server, Ron, was kicking butt and taking names all night. The bus boys and girls did a great job of keeping the waters and other beverages filled. Speaking of other beverages, the margaritas here are really delicious. Definitely recommended. There was a prix fixe menu for restaurant week which some partook of... the food sounded amazing but I wanted to eat light, so I got a salad instead, which was very tasty. The desserts looked awesome too, but again, didn't want an upset stomach on business travel, hah. I would probably come back here if I lived in the area, but I think if I am visiting again I'd want to try other places just to try them all out. Sitting outdoors was nice, btw, but I got chewed up by mosquitoes. D: (they have mosquitoes in Arizona?!) didn't help hearing about scorpions, snakes, and javelinas...I was turning around to look in the brush behind me the entire time to see if anything was going to jump out at me, Lmao!! Fun place to visit, though... and have not had as good a margarita back home!! But yeah desert wildlife, LOL.... not sure I'd be cut out for living the AZ life so to speak. But I digress!! Great meal, great place!!
Great spot. The complete remodel made major improvements. I recommend planning a patio night to drink in front of one of the many outdoor fireplaces

We came here during Restaurant Week for a special family dinner out. The location and facility are beautiful, the food is excellent, and the service was fantastic. 

First off, it is brilliant that they include the brunch menu along with the dinner menu. Everyone got excited about the brunch offerings, so I guess we'll have to go back to try that. 

Our waiter, Colin, and the other waitstaff were always on it: refilling drinks, clearing plates, and ensuring that everything about our meal was to our liking. We browsed the regular menu, but both my wife and I decided to order off the Restaurant Week menu so that we could try a wide variety of things. The kids both ordered off the kids menu (one had chicken fingers+fries and the other had macaroni and cheese -- nobody said they're adventurous eaters!)

My wife had a beef filet with mashed potatoes and sauted spinach. She said the steak was cooked well and the potatoes were good, but she did not enjoy the spinach as much. She had a salad to start. I think it was a Caesar. The polenta "croutons" were something different.

To start, I had the soup of the day, which was a green chile stew with pork. It had a bit of spice to it and was FANTASTIC. If that is on the day's menu and you enjoy green chiles, I highly recommend it.

For my main, I ordered the pork tenderloin with bacon risotto and asparagus (see the picture!). Why have more pork right after the pork stew when I could have had beef? Honestly, the bacon risotto hooked me, and it was SO worth it. Creamy, bacon-y and delicious, it was a perfect accompaniment to the asparagus and tenderloin. The tenderloin had a nice crust on it and was cooked nicely in the middle, if just a slight bit more done than I make mine. People tend to like their pork more well done than I do, so that's to be expected and I thoroughly enjoyed it. 

For dessert, one of us got the chocolate cake and the other the strawberry shortcake. Both were presented nicely... but I did not get pictures. People dug into them too quickly and my phone is old. The chocolate cake was moist and just the right amount of chocolatey. I liked the accompanying berries and whipped cream. The shortcake was a little dry, but the abundance of strawberry compote and whipped cream more than made up for it. In fact, the cake being a little dry allowed it to soak up more of the strawberry goodness, which was OK by me. 

I was called the next day by a member of the management, Lorenzo, I believe, to ask if everything was to my liking and if I wanted to provide any feedback. I thought that was nice and told him that we had a great experience and we would definitely be coming back.

This restaurant is one of the most amazing places I've ever been. If you come you must reserve a spot on the patio. It's gorgeous and even if the weather is warn their air units are fabulous. We had the greatest waiter we've ever had... Nate from Seattle. Ask for him. You won't regret it. 
Atmosphere beautiful... this place has been in operation since 1937! Unbelievable!
The food is outstanding! BUT have a discussion with your waiter because things can be creatively customized to match your tastes and preferences. My dish was no where on the menu or the specials list but it was one of the greatest dishes I've ever had. No one was disappointed and we all agree that if were ever back in Phoenix we're returning.

Meh I was under impressed. The quinoa dish was the only vegetarian entree aside from the veggie burger. I think it's overpriced for what you get. The food was somewhat bland. The truffle fries weren't bad and the sticky buns before the meal were a nice touch although I would've preferred bread and butter. The waiter was nice but a bit too much so Everytime we made eye contact the waiter would come over, it was a bit well overbearing.
Fantastic setting!!!  Food is excellent, and great first class service.  Love sitting on their patio for brunches and enjoying the serene scenery.

I had not been to El Chorro for many years. I was a bit nervous when I read some of the negative reviews. I went with two friends, celebrating our 40 year friendship. The evening was absolutely perfect. The atmosphere was absolutely beautiful. The service was excellent, and the food was outstanding. The filet was cooked to perfection. I will be back.

This review has to be broken into the tale of two worlds - happy hour and dinner.

First review will be our experience in the bar for Happy Hour and the Second in the dark, dark world of the outdoor dinner seating.

We valet parked our car without a care in the world. It was my wife's birthday so we thought we'd get to the restaurant early and enjoy the happy hour in the bar. Rachel was an absolutely lovely waitress. Our cocktails (party of five) and appetizers were simply a very warm, inviting, and lovely experience. The arisan cheese plate was enjoyable along with the grilled sausage trio. The happy hour buffet that is advertised simply didn't exist. Cocktails beyond their house pours were overpriced as expected. 

Overall the experience was very nice and I'd return for this portion of the evening. (but, you might want to read my review of the dinner experience).


---

After a lovely experience in the bar for happy hour (separate review) we were seated in the outdoor dining area (no one "got" us as we requested when our reservation was ready, and they didn't come to our table but asked us to come up to the hostess stand - no big deal but a bit tacky and awkward for all). 

(This is very sad as we're Phoenicians for 25 years and have experienced this restaurant over the years)

Our waiter, Eric, didn't seem to want to be there or make our experience better in any way. Eric seemed to have had a bad day and so would our table of five along with my wife, for her birthday celebration. 

We ordered directly from the dinner menu as we had just enjoyed app's in the bar. It was obvious that Eric wasn't' pleased with this but he marched off and placed our orders. 

Upon delivery (next time we saw Eric), all was just fine until I cut into my $44 strip steak. After some time, Eric stopped by and asked how dinner was. I showed him the steak and asked if it was medium. No, and he took it away. He came back and asked if I'd like another glass of Cab - well, no, unless your manager is buying so I might have it with the steak I ordered. Ten minutes later, when the rest of the table was about done with dinner, my steak was delivered. And, yes, it was cooked to a perfect medium (although, who's hungry after sitting that long and nibbling off everyone else's plates?). 

How's my wife's Birthday going? Well, not real well. Did Eric bring the wine, dessert, or anything to enhance the experience? No. I spoke with Alec, the manager, and he simply could not have cared less. His eyes were glazed-over as I explained the experience and lack of response from his staff. Alec was truly the manager of a restaurant that I would never want to experience again. He didn't sympathize, apologize, or even care about me or my family. 

DON'T GO HERE IF YOU WANT A GOOD EXPERIENCE! Spend your $ elsewhere.

I grew up in Paradise Valley, no not the Barry Goldwater part ( I WISH), the part near 32nd street and Shea Blvd. 

My family did attend a church on Lincoln Drive however,for 26 years, and we often went to El Chorro for various meals, and took our of town company there a lot. 

It's amazing patio and views of Camelback Mountain just say Arizona, I think.It's always been beautiful. The menu has changed a bit since I was a kid. Niman Ranch steak, what? 

But the tried and true sticky buns are good, no doubt. 

When I was a kid, I always wished I could have a pretty cocktail like the adults did. They looked icy and delicious. Humph. Those mean adults. 

Next time I'm there I'm totally having one... or two... and my kid can watch ME. 

Ha.

Although being sat without being greeted by our server for the first 15 minutes was rather agitating, it was quickly camouflaged by the free mimosas we were offered by a manager for the inconvenience. The food is great and is surprisingly inexpensive (I've only tried the brunch menu). The location is just beautiful and the service aside from the mishap in the beginning, is acceptable. I will be back and I would recommend to anyone looking for brunch in a beautiful setting at an affordable cost.

What an amazing meal! Entire place is redone and it looks amazing. I usually go for brunch but we decided the whole family would go for dinner. We started with the shrimp pot, shrimp cocktail, sausage plate, and chicken livers... All were really great but the entrees made the starters seem underwhelming because they were so well done. I highly recommend the wild caught salmon, the trout almandine and the pork tenderloin, those were table favorites!

I'm torn on my rating for the new El Chorro Lodge.  I had visited the "old" El Chorro Lodge prior to the renovations, and enjoyed it (although I found the bar area seriously lacking).  But last weekend was my first trip to the upgraded version, and it was a mixed bag.  First of all, let me say that if I were rating on ambience alone, this place would get a solid 5 stars.  Their patio area is extensive, and there are so many cozy nooks with semi-private fireplaces scattered around that it's easy to find a quiet corner to relax in with your special someone.  The bar area has been increadibly re-done, and is beautiful!  My friend and I sat at the bar, and were entertained by the live band playing just a few steps away.  

Now the downside.  The bartender that helped us (there were at least three behind the bar) was just ok.  He was very friendly, and very enthusiastic, but didn't seem very knowledgeable.  We asked him for drink specials, and were told there were none.  We asked for drink recommendations, and he had none.  We asked if they offered specialty martini's, and were told..."um....we have the El Chorro Martini"....finally we asked for the drink menu, and found that there actually were a BUNCH of different specialty cocktails and martinis that all looked appealing.  

I ordered a beer (I know, I know, after all that....but it sounded delicious), and my friend ordered one of the specialty martinis with basil.  After 5 minutes I got my beer.  After 10 minutes, still no cocktail for my friend.  We mentioned it to another bartender, who told us that he'd pass it along.  Then our bartender came back and began to make the drink....slowly....Finally, when it looked like it was ready to be presented, our bartended said "oh....I need to make you a new one.  The basil I used is still dirty"......and the process began again.

Once the drink was received, it tasted great and we enjoyed the rest of our evening.  I guess I'm going to give four stars as an average for the 5 star ambience and 3 star service received.  But I will definitely be going back soon.

Where do you start ? Great setting.Beautiful view.Wood fires,heaters for cool nights.Great bar and outdoor seating.Crowd is a great mix of older and younger. Awesome place to watch a game,but sound is off.Mix of snow birds,locals,and hotel/convention guests from the local Mega / Resorts all around this area.Wonderful service.

A remarkable experience from top to bottom. In my twelve years of living in the valley, it was my first time dining at El Chorro and I certainly was not disappointed in any way. From the ease of making a reservation on Opentable to speaking to the hostess on the phone and to being warmly welcomed upon our arrival - it was only the beginning of a great experience.

It was a lovely day today sitting on the patio and we had a a great server (Christopher). We both ordered eggs benedict and they were splendid and prepared and delivered to the table in no time. The legendary sticky buns also accompanied our meal and they were beyond delicious but not  as sticky as I expected :-)

El Chorro also serves dinner which I was not aware of and the menu looked very appealing. I highly recommend El Chorro as a special venue for get togethers, birthdays, family celebrations or just simply as a getaway for Sunday brunch or dinner. Enjoy!

Not even sure where to begin on this horrendous experience. First off I was giving El Chorro a second chance as I last ate here a couple of years ago and did not have a great experience but that was nothing compared to last night

My girlfriend and I wanted to treat her kids to an "iconic" Phoenix dining spot with a patio as her daughter was home for spring break and she graduates from college in a few months. Needless to say we wanted this to be a special evening. Unfortunately it was quite the opposite. 

After being seated we had to wait 20 minutes before our waiter even acknowledged us and then it was 45 minutes before we had cocktails served. We were not in a hurry and wanted to have a leisurely dinner but this was a bit much. 

After appetizers and ordering a bottle of wine for dinner we waited over an hour for our meals and also had to order an additional bottle due to the long delay. In the meantime the table next to us who was seated after us had finished their meal and we're leaving. 

By this time myself and my girlfriend were not only frustrated but embarrassed by the situation as we really wanted this to be a special evening. 

We expressed our frustration to both the waiter and the manager who never once during the course of the evening stop by our table. To their credit they did comp part of our meal but that was not the point as the evening had already all but been ruined. 

Then to top things off when the waiter dropped the bill off at the table he copped a whole lot of attitude about my being frustrated and stormed off. 

Then this morning we realized that we had never even been offered the so called signature sticky buns which pretty much demonstrates how messed up they were last night. 

Needless to say we will never be back and will certainly warn anyone not to as well.

Have been looking forward to trying this place for so long since I moved to Phoenix but was sadly very disappointed. When we arrived we had our pick of sitting outside or inside, and chose outside to watch the sunset. The sat us at probably the worst table right next to the wait staff area when the place was totally dead. I ordered a cup of the lobster corn bisque, which had okay flavor but the corn was practically raw and there were zero lobster chunks in the soup. The sticky buns were the only thing that lived up to the hype. During the middle of our dinner a manager and three waiters had to have a conversation about some VIP they were seating near us and kept going on and on about how special he is and deserves the best treatment, while we on the other hand had no service at all and had to sit and listen to this. Meanwhile back by the waiting station all of the wait staff kept complaining about the tables they were getting and we had to listen to that all night too. Overall the service is what ruined the experience and I likely won't go back because of it.

The grounds at El Chorro are delightful. They have a beautiful and relaxing patio. There are a lot of desert plants and trees. The restaurant has been open since about 1937 and there is an interesting history to learn about. The dining rooms are nostalgic of an earlier time in the desert. I ordered Brussel Sprout, Kale & Parmesean Salad.  The salad was quite delicious. It had roasted pepitas, almonds, dried cranberries and a Champagne Vinaigrette. I also ordered a Grilled Petite Filet with Brandied Dianne Sauce. The steak was very flavorful and was accompanied with mashed potatoes and French Green Beans. I picked out a dessert that was a Spiced Chocolate Tart with Espresso Creme Anglaise and Passionfruit sauce. It was very enjoyable.  A friend was with me and also ordered a Petite Fliet. Her steak had a huge chunk of gristle that was fat and two inches long. That is not enjoyable in the steak; especially when it is petite.  I figure the steaks are probably hand cut but in an establishment like this with a hefty price the meal should be perfect.  The manager kept passing by our table and didn't visit our table until he was flagged down. We noticed he visited tables all around the room and even outside on the patio but, it felt like he wanted to avoid our table.  A good manager would be aware of what is happening in the dining room and I would expect he would be proactive to address an issue rather than ignore guests.  I think the price is very expensive and the premium price should be met with premium service and a premium meal too.  We shouldn't be flagging a manager down and hearing the manager make excuses like we did.  I have dinned in other restaurants where the service was exceptional.

Went on a beautiful Sunday for a girlfriends bridal shower. This place is gorgeous. We had a separate area with a beautiful brunch buffet set up and it was lovely.  I'm not really able to write a well rounded review as I didn't dine as usual, but the food was delicious and the sticky buns are OUT OF THIS WORLD!!! I wasn't going to try one and another girl forced me to and they were TO DIE FOR! I'm stillllll craving them. I might have to go just to get a sticky bun fix.

I have lived in AZ for over 25 years and had heard this was a nice place to go. For our 27 Anniversary we decided to give it a try. We had planned to sit outside but the night we went it happened to be a very chilly night because of a recent system going through the state so we sat inside. 

We had drinks- gin and tonics. I had the house gin and my husband had the tanqueray. Mine tasted very chemical-ly. Noticeably different than my husbands. So I got the El Chorro Bloody Mary after that and it was good. 

Then we tried some appetizers- I got the grilled cheeses- very greasy. I didn't realize (nor do they tell you in the menu) that every piece has a different cheese inside. I am not a fan of blue cheese and of course that was the first one I ate. It was gross. And also the last one I ate.  My husband had the sausage plate and he enjoyed it. 

For dinner I had the special- prime rib. I asked for the end cut hoping it would not be crawling rare. Nope. It was. It was a huge piece of meat and I took most of it home, cooked it a little more, and then sliced it and added it to a salad. The twice baked potato and veggies that came with my meal were cold. Nothing fries me more than paying $200 for a meal and it being cold. Sigh. My husband had the pork tenderloin . He liked it. It came with a pile of carrots and broccolini. Niether of which he ate, and some kind of orzo which was ok. 

Then we tried dessert- he wanted to try the home churned ice cream. He liked it. I got the gooey caramel butter cake. It had some ice cream on top. It was ok.

I guess I was expecting to be blown away and wasn't. It was just ok. I probably would not go back and would not recommend anyone else go. For the price it just didn't wasn't over the top. Our server was ok. They couldn't manage to get the Dbacks on the big screen that was near us. Hmmm. Why? And something else kind of weirded me out. The hostess had a nice ruffley dress on- appropriate for this type of place yet she had flip flops on. Not nice ones, but kind of too casual ratty ones. That didn't impress me either.

I wanted to love it--great ambiance.  The hostesses were charming and the food was delicious, but the service was so so at best :(.  The patio was beautiful.  But...the server was bland, not particularly helpful and he was slow to respond.

Came here this weekend with a group of friends to celebrate a special occasion. We all uber-ed and had a reservation, so I can't speak on wait time or valet. I was surprised to see how beautiful the restaurant is. I've driven by too many times to count, but never got a glimpse past the front gate. The landscaping is gorgeous, and I liked that the decor wasn't over the top.

My meal was short, since I personally arrived a little late. But we had a large group, and our server was wonderful. I had a side Caesar salad as a starter, and the Beef Stroganoff as my entree. I love Caesar salads, and this one certainly satisfied. On to the Beef Stroganoff...It was slightly saltier than I would have preferred, but it didn't take away from the overall quality. Prices seem to be a little steep for the amount of food, but I didn't feel totally robbed after.

All in all, I would recommend checking the place out. I've heard the happy hour is great.

The El Chorro is a first class dining experience with a long history and repetition to preserve.  The location and setting is outstanding.  The cuisine is exceptionally good with portions that satisfy.  The food presentation is beautifully done offering creative delicious quality dishes that are balanced and well seasoned.  

We completely enjoyed our selections to the last bite.  They included braised short ribs, a filet with crab cake special and roasted jumbo shrimp with risotto.  The heirloom tomato with burrata salad is so delicious.  Having experienced Napa Valley cuisine for many years, the El Chorro is right there in the same class serving great food in the Southwest Desert.  The bartender for cocktails and our table server were top-notch and offered outstanding service.

One issue came up with the hostess that showed us to our table.  We asked to be seated at a table next to a window very close to the table we were given. The dining room was half empty with most customers seated outside on the patio.  She declined our request and told us the table was previously reserved.  We dined for three hours and the table we requested was never used, as were many other tables in the dining room.  

To uphold the top level of cuisine and customer service, let alone what we paid (+$300) for three - the hostess staff should always attempt to honor a customer's request and be sure they don't look unprofessional in the end.

The patio view, the food, and the history all combine to make this the #1 place to take guests visiting the valley. The food is pricey, but dependable.  Overall, the service is good.  I give it 5 stars for the ambience alone (oh, and make sure to try the sticky buns or a date shake).

The atmosphere and view is unparalleled but I think they know it. The food, while very good, took an inordinate amount of time on a Monday night with the restaurant not that full.
